loans.use: to buy raw materials such as different colored thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Zulola

texts.ru: Зулоле 18 лет. Она успешно окончила среднюю школу. Ее родители так мечтали, чтобы их дочь получила высшее образование. Однако экономическое положение семьи не позволяет им, чтобы Зулола продолжала учебу в университете. Зулола не упала духом и поставила цель открыть свой швейный цех, так как она с детства научилась у матери шитью женской одежды. Она участвовала на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она умная девушка и верит, что она будет вести свой бизнес. Она запрашивает займ для покупки швейной машинки и тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zulola is 18 years old and has successfully finished secondary school.  Her parents hoped that she would continue her education and go to college; however, her family's economic situation does not allow it at this time.  Undaunted, she has set another goal for herself: to open her own sewing shop.  This line of work suits her, as she learned how to make women's clothing from her mother when she was a child.  She is a clever girl, and is confident that she has what it takes to manage her own business.  She has taken a course titled "Attain Success"; it was organized by an association for businesswomen, and Zulola received a certificate upon completing the course.  To help set up her business, she is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine and various kinds of fabric.  She is counting on your generosity, and looks forward to your assistance.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine and fabrics for setting up a new business

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom, aged 48, is a married woman and a mother of two children. She has an animal sales business. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income.  She needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Carel

texts.fr: Carel est un homme de 27 ans fiancié père de 42 enfants de 8 mois et 3 ans. il fait dans la vente  des glaces dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 4 ans. son activié fonctionne bien mais n'a pas assez de lait et petit necessaire  alors il est à chaque fois obligé de faire faire tout son stock pour pouvoir s'approvisioner à nouveau d'ou la rupture permanente de ses stock. c'est pour celà qu'il sollicite ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter ses stock de lait, sucre et necessaire. Ceci augmentera non seulement se ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Carel is a 27-year-old man, engaged and the father of two children who are eight months and three years old. He has been selling ice cream in one of the capital's districts for the past four years.

His business is doing well but he doesn't have enough milk and other ingredients, so each time he has to sell his entire supply before he can resupply, which causes continuing stock shortages.

This is why he is requesting a loan that will enable him to increase his stock of milk, sugar and necessary ingredients. This will increase not only his sales but also his profits.

The profits will be partially reinvested to expand the business, and the rest will enable him to support his family's needs.

loans.use: increase his supply of milk and sugar

loans.name: Manzoora

texts.en: Manzoora is a 40-year-old married woman who has been in the milk selling business for the past 10 years. She has 1 buffalo and 2 cows to milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business allows her to lead a decent life. She has three children; one is in school. She is very motivated to provide a good life for them with quality education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet her family's daily living expenses. This is her 5th year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with its support. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase her milk production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.fr: marie est une femme de 50 ans  mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( tomates, piments,oignons...) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis des ananées. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai augmenter son stock de vivres en achetant en gros ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. Bénéfice qu'elle réinvestira en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 50-year-old woman and a mother. She is a merchant in one of the local markets, and for years has been retailing fresh produce (tomatoes, peppers, onions, ...), depending on the season.

She has a good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her customers that she has acquired over time given her experience in this field. However she finds herself constantly out of stock because she is forced to sell all her stock before she can resupply, due to her limited working capital.

She would like to increase her stock of produce by buying wholesale, which will not only increase her sales but also her profits.

The profits will be partly reinvested to expand her business and the rest will enable her to support her family's needs.

loans.use: increase her stock of tomato crates, hot peppers and onions

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr: Salamatou est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée , mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 et 12 ans, tous vont déjà à l'école.elle est une ancienne commerçante qui gère depuis 11 ans un petit centre d'appel téléphonique( call box)et une petite échoppe dans un quartier de la capitale.Du fait de la petitesse des bénéfices générés par ses activités, de l'augmentation considérable de sa clientèle et de la constante rupture de stock , elle voudrait ce crédit afin de pouvoir régulièrement s'approvisionner en crédit de communication auprès des opérateurs téléphoniques ce qui augmentera considérablement son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui lui permettra de réinvestir dans son échoppe afin de l'agrandir et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salamatou is a young 35-year-old woman, married and mother of three children whose ages vary from 6 to 12 years. All the children attend school.

She is an experienced merchant who for the past 11 years has been managing a small phone call center (call box) and a small stall in one of the capital's neighborhoods.

Due to the limited income generated by these businesses, the considerable increase in her customer base and constantly being out of stock, she would like this loan so she can regularly stock up on communication credits with the telephone operators, which would considerably increase her profits.

These profits would allow her to reinvest to expand her stall and also meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Hasan is still a student in a local college where he studies engineering. Hasan would like to finish his studies with very high grades so he can find a good job and help his family in the future.

Hasan took a 625 USD loan from FATEN. This loan helped him buy a new laptop that he needs to use engineering programs to do his class projects and homework. Hasan appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu lives and works in New-Kru-Town, Liberia, which is one of the country's poorer areas. She is 28 years old and is married to a nurse. Fatu did not attend school. For the past 6 years now she has been selling rubber dishes such as bowls, pans, plates, spoons, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a little money that she earned from her husband. She says she enjoys selling to her customers and the money she generates from her business every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes such as bowls, pans, plates, and spoons, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes such as bowls, pans, plates, spoons, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 44-year-old married man with two sons and one daughter. He lives with his wife and children in a simple house in Khanyounis. For several years, Ismael has worked as an employee in the public sector for a very low wage. This wage is not enough to cover all of his family's needs, so he decided to open his own business renting wedding supplies like chairs and tables. Ismael dreams to improve his business.

Ismael took a 3,976 USD Murabah loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chairs and tables for wedding parties. This will increase his income and also improve the family's living conditions. Ismael appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and tables for wedding parties

loans.name: Leh We Pay Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Leh We Pay Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT and Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 400,000 Sierra Leonean leone (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Yei is the featured leader of this group. Yei is 50 years old, married, and has four children: two in primary school, one in secondary and one in college. Yei sells palm oil, onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. and has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy palm oil, onions, Maggi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, Maggi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a 32-year-old Iraqi married client, who has a child and works hard to provide his family's income alone.
Mouhammad owns a blacksmith shop, where he specializes in making doors and windows from metal. He has a long experience in this field and has been practicing this business since 2010. Now Mouhammad has hired an employee and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Mouhammad is requesting a loan of 2,400 United States dollars (USD). The aim of this loan is to buy a specific machine used for melting metals and to increase his inventories. Mouhammad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a specific machine used for melting metals and to increase his inventories

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en: Shafqat is a 41-year-old woman. She is an energetic single parent of five children and supports her family. She has been in the shoe making business for many years. During the initial year of her business, she had low capital because of problems receiving payments on time and was unable to expand her business activities. But with the support of Kashf Foundation she has gradually improved her business. She is now in her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. Shafqat requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy raw materials including thread, leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles. With this loan, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence can better support her family.

loans.use: to buy raw material  including thread, leather, artificial leather, and plastic soles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food stuff such as flour, kalesa, and beans

loans.name: Amber

texts.en: Amber is a 24-year-old married lady and a mother of two. Her husband is a sweeper so she decided to work for herself to support her family for a better future. Twelve years ago she started doing stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family.  However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Amber has borrowed 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials including cloth, different colored thread, lace, zippers, etc. so she may be able to generate a larger source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, different colored thread, lace, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high crime rate, rare bathroom facilities,  filthy conditions,  and over population. However, it is interesting that in New Kru room rents are a bit cheaper, there are transportation options, the town contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and food is less expensive. 

Finda is 28 years old and married to a local businessman. They have two children aged 1 and 7. For the past five years now Finda has been selling rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. She started this business with a small amount of money that she earned by selling charcoal for her friend. Finda says she enjoys selling to her customers and the money she generates from her business everyday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Iason

texts.en:
Iason is a 33-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and son in a small village in the Senaki district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and two calves. His wife milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources, and because he had to start working at a very young age, Iason was unable to study for a professional career.  As the family has only seasonal income, Iason decided to start selling clothes and sought credit among local financial institutions. However, his attempts were unsuccessful, because of his poor living conditions. The start-up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get loans for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 900 USD. He will purchase clothes to sell with the loan.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una señora casada de 47 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijas la primera de 15 años y la segunda de 13 años ambas aún se encuentran estudiando en el Departamento de Sololá.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por el  bienestar de su familia. Actualmente cuenta con un molino de nixtamal (sirve para moler maíz cosido),  el cual es utilizado para la elaboración de tortillas. Eligio esta actividad ya que cuando era pequeña su padre tenía un molino de nixtamal, es como de esta manera obto por esta labor que hasta el momento le  ha generado ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le han  ayudado a sufragar los gastos de su familia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo  de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de otro molino de nixtamal,  con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y ganancias.
Su sueño es mejorar su economía familiar y sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 47-year-old married woman. She lives with her two daughters, the first aged 15 and the second aged 13, who are both still students in the Sololá Department. She is a hardworking woman who fights for the well-being of her family.

She currently has one nixtamal mill (used to mill cooked corn), which she uses to make tortillas. She chose this activity because when she was little, her father had a nixtamal mill. So that was how she chose this work, which up to now has made her an income and acceptable profits that have helped her to defray the expenses of her family.

She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 GTQ to buy another nixtamal mill, in order to increase her income and profits. Her dream is to improve her family's economic situation and to help her children do well in their studies so that in the future they will have better work opportunities.

loans.use: To buy a nixtamal mill (used to mill cooked corn)

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for 15 years with the help of her husband. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to cover the expenses of her family members. She is a motivated mother of four and is responsible for providing them with good quality food, education, and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 40,000 PKR. The loan will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities to cater to more customers without delay. She hopes to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers.

loans.name: Tulipanes Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento TULIPANES, está  compuesto por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos varones, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Tarcila en la foto la que está sola inclinada tiene 33 años,  tiene 4 hijos de las edades de 12, 10 , 7 y 2 años, que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella  se dedica a la venta de comida  en su puesto fijo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Tarcila va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de insumos como abarrotes para elaborar sus paltillos, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital, la Sra. Tarcila enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que los  precios han subido y muchas veces los insumos  escasean y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Tarcila es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en:
The Tulipanes community bank is made up of ten members, eight of whom are women. Tarcila is president of the bank. In the photo, she is the woman kneeling.

Tarcila is 33 years old, and has four school-age children, ages 12, 10, 7 and 2. She works selling food from a permanent stall. This is Tarcila’s first loan sequence with the community bank. She says that her reason for requesting this loan is that she lacks the capital to invest in her business.

Tarcila says that her business faces some challenges because prices have gone up and there are often shortages of ingredients. She will use this loan to continue buying ingredients to make her food. Tarcila is a very hard-working person who says that she feels happy and thankful for the support the community bank gives her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Saadiya

texts.en:
Saadiya is from Iraq. She is 57 years old, married, and has 3 children. Saadiya, her husband, and 2 of her children provide for the family's income together. Saadiya runs a small grocery store that is widely known in her neighborhood. She sells many products like snacks, drinks, detergents, and dairy products. She has been running this grocery store since 2010 and has much experience in this field. She now has hired an employee and is respected by the entire neighborhood.

Saadiya is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. This loan will be used to install an external ceiling for her grocery store and to buy more goods to sell. Saadiya is aiming to continue assisting her husband in providing their family with income so they may overcome their current financial issues.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling for her grocery store and to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Don Juan, tiene 64 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de Yoro. Don Juan se ha dedicado a la agricultura y albañilería. Hace 12 años que el se dedica a la venta de verduras como repollo, papas, aguacate, frutas, cilantro y productos de abarrotería. Su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante en algunos puntos estratégicos de la comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 lempiras para comprar productos como verduras y abarrotes para la venta con el fin de obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan es salir a delante con su negocio y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 64 years old, is married with five children and lives in the municipality of Yoro. He has worked in agriculture and construction. For the past 12 years he has been selling vegetables such as cabbage, potatoes, avocados, and cilantro, as well as grocery products. His business is mobile and moves between several strategic points in the community.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 HNL to buy products such as vegetables and groceries to sell, in order to obtain a better profit. His plan is to move forward with his business and family.

loans.use: to buy more product for his business, such as potatoes, avocados, cabbage, papaya, etc.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en: Kahindi lives in the Likoni area, South of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a 21-year-old, single businessman. He has been hawking for three years now as his major economic activity. He specializes in hawking electronic items. He found out about Milango through friends and he decided to join so that he could access capital to fund the business. He now seeks a loan to rent a shop so that his customers can find him in one location. He hopes that the business will grow to be stable and feed him as well as his extended family. He will use the income raised to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to rent a shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase engine oil, farm belts, and motor batteries for resale

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, tiene 43 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Lleva 6 años de dedicarse al comercio, vender cosméticos como ser cremas, maquillaje, lociones, y también ropa y zapatos. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y vende por pedidos también. Ha obtenido 4 prestamos con la institución con este actual que solicita el cual es por 25,000 Lempiras, que los utilizara para surtir de ropa y zapatos y poder tener mayor inventario que ofrecer a los clientes y obtener mas ganancias. Su plan es crecer como comerciante para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 43 years old and is in a common-law-marriage with her husband, with whom she has two children. They  live in a small town in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. She has worked in commerce for six years, and sells cosmetics such as creams, makeup, and lotions, as well as clothing and shoes. She does this out of her house and also sells by order. 

She has obtained four loans with the institution from which she now requests this current loan, for 25,000 HNL, which she will use to acquire clothing and shoes and to be able to have a larger inventory of products to offer her clients, and to make more profits.her plan is to grow her business in order to provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children, two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, and healthcare. Her husband is employed in a furniture shop. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. Eight years ago, Rafia started her business sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is very familiar with stitching techniques and enjoys a large client list.  Rafia has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a new sewing machine and some spools of different colored thread so that she can meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some spools of different colored thread.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for the past four years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to cover the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill his family member's demands. 

Shumaila is a motivated mother of three children and is responsible for providing them with good quality food, education, and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani Rupees). The loan will be used to purchase large quantities of thread, rubber bladders, and leather covers to cater to more customers without delay. She hopes to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and hopes to use part of her profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of thread, rubber bladders, and leather covers.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of three.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past ten years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and zippers in various colors. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses in less time, and that will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of buttons and zippers in various colors

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 24 years old and he lives in the Likoni area south of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married man blessed with two children, one of whom goes to school. He is a hawker and he has been in the business for more than three years now. He joined a group of other hawkers to join Milango so that they could save money and access credit to fund their businesses. He now seeks a loan to rent a shop so that he can wait on customers in one place. His business is challenging and sometimes he is not able to make sales. The extra income that he will raise will improve his standard of living and educate his children.

loans.use: to rent a shop

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 4 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community and to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.

Now she has requested a loan worth 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in different colors. It will help her to meet the orders of her customers on time. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of sequins, pearls and stones in different colors

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael  es un hombre casado de 33 años de edad, padre de cuatro hijos de los cuales 1 hombre y 3 mujeres, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá. 
El se dedica al cultivo agrícola, sembrando papa a  unos metros de su vivienda. Comenta que lleva 10 años en esta actividad que hasta el momento es rentable y productiva. 
Gracias a los consejos de su padre ahora tiene un trabajo seguro sin necesidad de ir a trabajar a otro lugar. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir al sustento familiar.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de semillas de papa y fertilizante químico para poder cultivarlo y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia en cuanto a educación, vestuario y alimentación.
texts.en:
Rafael is a married man, 33 years old, and the father of four children, one man and three women, who live in the Sololá Department.

He grows crops, planting potatoes on several meters of land where he lives. He tells us that he has been doing this for the past ten years and that so far it is profitable and productive.

Thanks to his father's advice, he now has a secure job and does not need to go elsewhere for work. Through the work he does, he makes an income and acceptable profits which help him to contribute to sustaining his family.

He is requesting a loan of 4,000 GTQ to buy potato seed and chemical fertilizer in order to be able to grow the seed and so increase his profits.

His dream is to make more profits in order to improve his family's quality of life in education, clothing, and food.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and chemical fertilizer

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is 25 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for four years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Abida was not working, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner as her husband was the sole bread winner of the family. Abida felt obligated to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she is struggling to fill large orders. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR. It will allow her to buy a new stitching machine and some spools of different colored thread.  She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine and some spools of different colored thread.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been working in hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income and dreams for her children's bright and prosperous future. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, cigarettes, soap and drinks for resale

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house.  Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in New Kru town. She is 48 years old, a widow with six children aged between 18 and 31; only two are in school and live at home. 

For the past nine years she has been selling roasted cassava and cold water along the side of the road. She started this business by selling rice and the few goods she could afford in the communities around her. She learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava and water by the sack for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and water by the sack for her business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Un joven de 30 años es Julio, que se esfuerza por salir adelante, dedicado a sus estudios, trabaja para una empresa privada como ejecutivo de ventas, cursa la carrera de Ing. en Sistemas los domingos, y los días de semanas asiste a clases de ingles, cuenta con el apoyo económico de un primo para sustentar sus gastos tanto universitarios como personales, ya que Julio recibe  un salario muy bajo. Solicita este apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera el cual culminara muy pronto a finales de este año.
texts.en:
Julio is a young man, 30 years old, who makes an effort in order to get ahead. 

He studies, works for a private company as a sales executive, studies for his degree in Systems Engineering on Sundays, and takes English classes during the week. He has the financial support of a cousin to cover his personal and university expenses, as Julio receives only a very low salary. 

He requests this loan in order to pay the costs of officially obtaining his degree, which he will finish quite soon, at the end of this year.

loans.use: to pay the costs of obtaining his degree

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, bags of rice and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food items including toothpaste, soap, drinks and fishing equipment for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more malarial drugs, blood syrup and cholera drugs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sandals, shoes and slippers for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is 35 years old and lives with his family: his parents and his brother. Ahmad and his brother take the responsibility of providing the family income together.

Ahmad owns a workplace where he specializes in repairing motor generators. This business in highly demanded in his neighborhood since there is much use for motor generators. Ahmad has a long experience in this field. He established his own independent business in 2000. Now Ahmad has two hired employees and is being well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to expand his shop inside and to buy some spare parts used for his work. Ahmad believes that this loan will give him the chance to grow his business and will result in the improvement of his current financial conditions and will grant him the ability to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to expand his shop inside and to buy some spare parts used for his work.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. For the past two years, she has been running business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family at a point in time when her husband was the only bread-earner. 

With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks for resale.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 41 years old, a vigorous, married woman and a mother of five children. She has had business of clothes sales for many years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well, while Tahira has become popular in her town for providing good quality clothes and she is the best-earning resource in her household. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy bundles of clothes in various colors and designs. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a farmer from Ijevan city of Tavush region. She lives with her husband, two school-age daughters (7 and 9 years old) and her elderly pensioner father-in-law. Alla's husband works in the private sector. However his salary is so low, that he cannot meet the family's basic needs. 

Alla, with the help of her husband, is engaged in breeding livestock including a piglet, cows, and hens and in beekeeping. She also cultivates corn, beans, potato and several kinds of fruit (cherry, plum, pomegranate, blood orange, apple, pear and walnut). Farming is the most important source of the family's income. 

As their needs are increasing day by day, Alla needs to enlarge her agribusiness a little bit. A loan of USD 1,500 will be a big support to her and her family and will help them purchase three heifers to add to their livestock. Alla and her family will be thankful to the lenders for supporting them to maintain and improve their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three heifers.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Massah is 30 years old and married with three children between the age of four and 13 years. She runs a domestic products stall in Tombo, Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2007 and sells sets of pans, baskets and food containers in her community. She says that the main problem for her business is her improper business location.

Massah requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more sets of pans, plates, cups and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more sets of pans, plates, cups and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 37 years old and married with two children, aged two and nine. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married and sells palm oil within her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to pay her children's school fees.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Vanuhi

texts.en:
Vanuhi is an experienced agronomist from the village of Taperavan in Ararat region. Her family consists of her husband, daughter, son and sister-in-law. Vanuhi's husband and son have migrated to Russia and are working there to be able to take care of the family's needs. 

Vanuhi and her family are engaged in cultivation of wheat and several fruits (peach, apricot, cherry, plum, pomegranate, apple and pear). Wheat and fruit cultivation is an important source of income for the family. To be able to continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Vanuhi needs some financial resources.

A loan of USD 3,000 will be very helpful to her and her family, enabling them to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizers and diesel fuel for agricultural machinery as well as to pay for irrigation and harvesting services. Vanuhi and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizers and diesel fuel for agricultural machinery and to pay for irrigation and harvesting services.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia lives in New Kru town. She is 26 years old, married and has five children aged between 10 and 33. Only two are attending in school and live at home.

For the past 24 years, she has been selling rice, pepper, bitter-ball, okra, etc in the local market.  She sells for nine hours per day from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter-ball, okra, etc. for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and to see her children get through high-school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter-ball and okra for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 35 years old and lives in the New Kru Town area which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a security officer; together they have two children age 13 and 15 years old, who are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past six years she has been selling rice by the cup in the local market. She make a lots of profit and has lots of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

Her plans are to build a house and own a store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mbalu from Tombo, western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children aged between five and 15 years. One of her children is going to school. After the war, Mbalu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes purchasing power is very slow.

Mbalu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing and cosmetics for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Mbalu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
The Gold Cambridge School was open by Ms. Allah Rakhi in March 2001. She says: “a few students were enrolled at that time and school expenses were double whereas school income was nothing for us. I involved my younger daughter so some administrative work could be managed by her properly. I look after other school matters such as teacher duties, student enrollment, the school environment and overall management. All the burdens of the school were on our shoulders. We worked so hard to run this school with multiple roles." 

"Now I am 57, but I still have a great enthusiasm for my school because my community gave me a lot of respect and dignity because of the reputation of my school,"  Allah Rakhi says. "My school is serving a marginalized community and providing quality education."

She is very old client of Kashf and taking a loan for her school she says “Kashf Foundation always helps us and supports our efforts for a noble cause. I have taken a loan of PKR 100,000 from the ‘School Sarmaya program’ and will use it to buy furniture, printing copies, dairies and paints as well."

She is very thankful for the organization's help in building their capacity and also for the loan to develop the school. Allah Rakhi says “now I will give my best and focus on education quality”.

loans.use: to purchase furniture, printing copies, dairies and paints.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Here is 26-year-old Mary from Liberia. She lives in New Kru town. She is married and has two children aged two and nine. 

For the past six years, she has been selling coal, cassava, palm-nuts, etc in the local market. She started this business with a loan from her friend and learned this way of selling from her friends. She sells for nine hours per day from Monday to Saturday. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal, cassava, palm-nuts, etc. for her business. She plans to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coal, cassava and palm-nuts for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks, a fan and a music set to expand her business.

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.es: Beatriz de 23 años de edad, habita junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Es una mujer muy entregada al trabajo fuerte y perseverante que siempre trata de hacer lo mejor y entrega todo por su familia. Actualmente trabaja lavando ropa ajena por la forma como se desempeña trabajando se ha hecho de abundante clientela. Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de lamina galvanizada y pagar la mano de obra, así cambiar el techo existente, ya que el que tiene está muy picado filtrándose el agua mojando las pocas pertenecías que tienen. Espera que pronto realizar este trabajo para su tranquilidad.
texts.en: Beatriz is 23 years old. She lives with her life's companion and her little two year old son. She is a woman who is very dedicated to working hard and persevering. She always tries to do her best and give everything to her family. Right now, she works laundering other people's clothes and the way she does her job has earned her a lot of customers. She wants to improve her home and that is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized sheet metal and to pay for labor to replace the roof. The one she has has a lot of holes and water gets in and gets what few belongings she has wet. She hopes she can have this work done soon so she can have peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and pay for labor and other materials to put on a new roof.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is married and has seven children, all of whom go to school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to meet the family's basic needs.

Tumaini has operated a coconut selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia, living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of criminal activity, few bathrooms, filthy conditions and overpopulation. But the most interesting part is that rooms are bit cheaper, there is the option of traveling, and it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, along with lower rates for food.
   
Nancy is single and has 4 children, whose ages are between 12 and 30; only one of her children is currently attending school and two live at home. She was able to attend school before starting her business. For the past 9 years she has been busy running her cook shop which sells fufu (dough made of cassava) and soup. With the loan proceeds she will buy more fufu, pepper, oil, dry fish, dry meat, onions, charcoal etc. for her business. She said that, besides having fewer goods in stock, "I have no other problems for now". Nancy managed to establish the business with a little money from her mother, and she learned by observing other businesswomen. She said: "I enjoy the flow of costumers and the fast buying". Her dreams are to move from the cook shop business to a mordant restaurant business and for her and her children to live better lives in future.

loans.use: to buy more fufu, pepper, oil, dry fish, dry meat, onions, charcoal etc. for her business.

loans.name: Aelita

texts.en:
Aelita is a farmer from the village of Sayat-Nova in Ararat region. Her family consists of her husband (pictured in the photo), two little sons (7 and 4 years old) and her youngest daughter (3 years old; pictured in the photo). To be able to take care of the family Aelita and her husband are involved in breeding a livestock (pigs and hens), as well as cultivation of beans, eggplant and alfalfa. Aelita’s husband helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

The family's agribusiness currently needs some investments to function in a sustainable way. Aelita and her family need a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase some forage for the livestock, to buy a cow and to pay for harvesting services. They will be very grateful to all the lenders for their good will in supporting the maintenance and development of their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some forage for the livestock, to buy a cow and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Mahawa

texts.en:
Mahawa is at 47 years old and married. She has five children between the ages of 9 and 25 years. She sells wax cotton in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2011 and sells wax cotton within her community.  She says that her business is doing well because it enables her to take care of her children.

Mahawa requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more wax cotton and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en:
Zuma lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 37 years old and he is a trained carpenter. He is a married man with four children whom he takes care of, together with his wife. 

He has been in the carpentry business for more than 25 years and this is what has been feeding the family. In five years time he wants to employ at least ten staff and own a workshop. 

He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy timber for his business. The major challenge in the business has been getting customers.  The income that he will raise will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary growing region for bananas and sugar cane. She has five children and has been doing this work for 25 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is that it is a source of income. Her biggest challenge is lack of a market. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Alice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Because it trains clients before giving loans." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "How to manage finances and not to divert them."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked  how this loan will benefit her family, Alice replied, "Improve living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alice owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, a sewing machine, a TV and a DVD but does not have electricity, solar power or running water.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alex Omar

texts.es:
El señor Alex de 23 años de edad,  vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación ubicada en aldea la cuesta en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace mas de 03 años a la venta de verduras como ser sandillas, melones, tomates, naranjas, plátano, aguacates, tomates,  etc.
Don Alex sus clientes son sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad y sus ventas son de lunes a domingo en donde el sale a vender a diferentes lugares y se transporta en su vehículo. 
Don Alex está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mas melones, sandias, piñas, mangos, bananos, etc. y salir a vender  a diferentes lugares y así poder mejorar los ingresos para su hogar y seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Don Alex su sueño es poder incrementar mas su negocio..

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013
texts.en:
Alex is 23 years old. He lives with his wife in a house located in the town of La Cuesta in southern Honduras. For more than 3 years he has worked selling produce such as watermelons, melons, tomatoes, oranges, plantains, avocados, tomatoes, etc.

Alex' customers are his friends and neighbors in his community and he sells Mondays through Sundays, going out to different places in his vehicle. Alex is asking for the loan to buy more melons, watermelons, pineapples, mangos, bananas, etc. and to go out to different places to improve the income for his household and keep growing in the business.

Alex's dream is to expand his business more. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2013

loans.use: to buy melons, watermelons, pineapples, mangos, bananas, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, bricks, galvanized sheet metal and wood, as well as to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal lives in the coastal region of Kenya with her family: her husband and their ten children. She lives in her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

She sells timber to passersby and neighbors.She has been in this business for the last five years. She cites seasonality and transportation costs as her major challenges.

Racheal is requesting a loan to purchase more timber for resale. She expects to do this without any difficulties and to continue working without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale.

loans.name: Sophiko

texts.en:
Sophiko is a 29-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village of Khobi district with her husband, two children and parents-in-law. Sophiko is a housekeeper and her children go to a local public school. Her parents-in-law are provided with a retirement pension.

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 cows. Sophiko milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. In addition. they have a plot of agricultural land, where maize and nut trees are grown. They work hard to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold to local retailers. As the income is only seasonal, Sophiko decided to request a loan for the family business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2,400 for purchasing a used car. After the used car is purchased her husband will serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase their income and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a used car for her husband to work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Aghasi

texts.en: Aghasi is a farmer from Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He lives with his wife, school-age daughter and one-year-old son. Aghasi breeds livestock, specifically: cows and pigs. Aghasi is actively engaged in the agriculture business. He also makes special combined forage for poultry and sells it. Farming is the only source of the family's income. Aghasi's wife helps him a lot with the usual farming activities. Aghasi currently needs a loan of $2,000 USD to purchase some forage (vitamins and concentrates). The loan will help him a lot with effectively running his agribusiness and it will help him develop it further. Aghasi and his family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their good will in helping them collect the necessary loan amount to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some forage (vitamins and concentrates)

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 40 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 11 years. She runs a domestic product shop in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2007 and sells glass cups, knives and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem facing her business is the sometimes slow purchasing power.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is a young, private entrepreneur from Yerevan city. His family consists of his parents, his sister and his brother. 

Hakob is the only breadwinner of the family. He runs a retail shop of sunglasses and different accessories. The assortment of goods he sells in the store is not that big. Hakob currently needs to expand it a bit in order for his small business to be competitive and to function in a sustainable way. 

Hakob needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase accessories and sunglasses to resell in his store. As this is Hakob’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Hakob will be very thankful to the lenders for their good will in supporting him to develop his small business.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and sunglasses to resell in his store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 27 years old and he is a married businessman with two children. 

He is a tailor and that is what he does for daily bread. He has been in the business for the last five years and the business is doing great despite the usual challenge of competition. 

He knew Milango through a friend who invited him and he joined. He now seeks a loan to buy cloth material for the shop. The extra income that he will raise will improve his living standards and he will also pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy cloth material.

loans.name: Emik

texts.en:
Emik is 55 years old and he lives in Kajaran city. Emik is married and he has two children (a daughter and a son). His daughter is already married and she lives separately with her family. 

Emik has two higher education degrees. First, he graduated from the Pedagogical State Institute in Goris City, the department of Mathematics and Physics. Then, he graduated from the Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute, the department of Industrial Electronics. Now, Emik works at the local electricity networks as a head of the customer service department. Recently, as the result of many years of saving, Emik managed to repair his flat.
 
Emik asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy switches, fuse boxes and electrical cords since all of these are worn out and need to be changed.

loans.use: to buy switches, fuse boxes and electrical cords since all of these are worn out and need to be changed.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is married, and has five school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES, Furaha wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bicycle and food to stock.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina lives in New Kru town.  She is 33 years old, single, and has three children between 3 to 15 years old, all in school and living at home. 

Edwina was unfortunate in not being able to attend school, but she has been keeping herself busy with business over the past 12 years selling palm oil, beans, imported oil, etc., in the local market. She started this business with a little money from her mother. 

She said that fewer goods on her table are the only business challenge she faces now. She likes her business because it is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She said I am proud of my business because it is the only means of I and my family surviving.   With the loan, she is going to buy more palm oil, beans, imported oil, etc., to resell.  

Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, beans, imported oil, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 34 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her boutique, selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Rose, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is from Metsamor town, where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children. She works as a nurse in a local clinic and provides medical services from her house. As the village is not rich with clinics and hospitals, people need a medical specialist who is able to provide needed services right from her house.
 
Due to her kindness and hard work, Armenuhi is in great demand among both local villagers and people from nearby villages. Now this hardworking woman needs financial assistance to be able to renovate her electrocardiography machine and provide cardiac checks to her clients.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products, so this loan is very important for Armenuhi and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of electrocardiography machine

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta lives in New Kru town. She is 42 years old and she is married. She has four children between 26 and 16 years old. Two are in school and live at home. 

She did not go to school, so she decided to keep herself busy with business by selling food like peanuts, pepper, beans, etc. to improve her life. She started this business with a little money from her husband eight years ago. She said that fewer goods on her table are the only challenge she faces now. She likes her business because is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She said she is proud of her business because it is the only means she has of helping her children. She said that with the loan she is going to buy more peanuts, pepper, beans, etc. to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts, pepper, beans, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is from Armavir town. He lives with his wife and two children (his son is 21 years old and his daughter is 13 years old). 

Sargis sustains his living by trading tuff stones. He purchases stones from a tuff quarry of the Aragatsotn region and sells them to local people in Armavir town. Sargis has also a big number of customers in Yerevan town. He has been doing this business for 15 years. Sargis's wife works at a local school as a teacher and tries to help her husband in sustaining the family's living. 

Currently Sargis and his family are facing financial big difficulties. Sargis has no money for purchasing tires for his truck so he is asking this loan.

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Sargis will be very grateful to lenders for supporting him to buy new tires.

loans.use: to pay for tires.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is 48 years old. She lives in Gavar city which is in Gegharkunik region. She has studied at the Gavar city Industrial College.  

Siranush is married and she has two sons; her elder son lives and works in the Russian Federation and the smaller son lives with them and works as a deliverer at the local major company of mineral water production. 

Siranush’s husband in unemployed and, together with his wife, he is engaged in farming and agriculture. They have a small and cute farm where they are raising two calves, two piglets and 20 chickens. They also cultivate beans, potatoes, tomatoes and cabbage. Siranush manages to sell the gathered harvest at their local wholesale market, but the income from their vegetable garden hardly covers their family's needs, so their wish to enlarge their farm with several animals still remains unrealized. 

Siranush has decided to ask a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several piglets and start swine breeding, and she also wants to buy animal fodder for the coming winter. Her four loans from Nor Horizon Siranush have been successfully paid back and she waits for this loan impatiently to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: To buy several piglets and fodder.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 30 years old. She is married to a local businessman and they have 2 children, ages 8 and 15. Her children are currently attending school and live at home. 

Esther was fortunate to complete 9th grade, but she has been busy running her table where she sells cosmetics in the local market. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more cosmetics for her business. Fewer goods is her challenge. With a little money from her mother, Esther managed to establish this business 6 years ago, and learned by seeing other business people. She enjoys the flow of customers and the fast buying. Her plan is to move from a table business to a shop business and live better lives in the future.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Kilifi, Kenya. She is 23 years old and single. Hellen owns a cosmetics shop and a clothes business that she started three years ago. Her business has been doing well. 

Hellen learned of Milango Financial Services through friends, who invited her to join so that they could save and be able to access credit to fund their business. Now, Hellen seeks a loan to buy cloth material, shoes and weaves to sell. The major challenges that Hellen faces are high fuel and transportation costs.

In the next five years, Hellen hopes that her business will grow to be stable. She will use the extra income to increase her savings.

loans.use: buy cloth material, shoes and weaves.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. Kakamega County has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

David is married, and has seven children. Both he and his wife have been farming for fifteen years.  They currently do dairy farming as well as tend to a tea plantation. David wanted to become a beekeeper because “I love honey as medicine, the income that comes from it and [there is] no hard work when it comes to beekeeping.”

This is David’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to expand his farming activities. His hope for the future is to invest in a good house for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit is 24 years old. He lives in Yerevan with his mother, father and retired grandmother. His elder brother and sister are already married and they live in the Russian Federation with their families. Davit works at the bookmaker office as an administrator. His mother does not work and his father is a shoemaker, but unfortunately recently he has had some health problems. These problems are serious ones, since it is connected with his heart. After the last examination, the doctor declared that Davit’s father needs to have an urgent operation. This is a great and unpleasant surprise for Davit and his family, so Davit asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for his father’s for cardiac surgery.

loans.use: to pay for his father’s for cardiac surgery

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are currently in school. For the past 12 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food.

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food in the restaurant to sell, and will help Margret generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Margret hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business into a motel. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to stock more food for the restaurant.

loans.name: Jasmena

texts.en:
Jasmena is a nurse from Metsamor town. She has been providing medical services to locals for 15 years. Due to her hard work, Jasmena currently has many clients who prefer only her services. She provides different types of medical services including immunization, blood pressure measurement, etc. 

Now, Jasmena needs financial support in order to purchase an electrocardiography machine so as to provide cardiac checking service to her patients. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan is very important for Jasmena and she hopes for the lenders' trust and support.

Jasmena has three grown up children who are married and live with their families.

loans.use: to pay for an electrocardiography machine.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin lives and works outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Martin is married and has five children. Both he and his wife are farmers and are currently tending to cows and poultry on their land. Martin likes beekeeping because it produces good income with little work, and will allow him another source of revenue from his land. 

This is Martin’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to pay his children’s school fees. His hope for the future is to expand his farming activities and be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 46 years old and lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions and over-population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options of traveling, it has one of the biggest markets in Liberia and food costs less.    

Annie is a widow with three children whose ages are between 7 and 22; only two of her children are currently attending school and live at home. She was unfortunate to attend school, but she has been busy running her shop, which sell soft drinks. With the loan proceeds, Annie will buy more soft drinks for her business. She works 10 hours each day of the week. With a little money from her mother, Annie managed to establish this business 7 years ago. She enjoys the flow of customers. She plans to move from a shop business to a store business.

loans.use: buy more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya, and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old grown trees in the forest, and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Arnold is married and has six children. His wife works as a teacher, while Arnold farms their land. He has been farming for twenty five years, and is currently farming some crops as well as raising cattle. He likes beekeeping because it is a source of income that will allow him to further profit from his land. 

This is Arnold’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is an area that does not suffer from a dry season. She has three children and has been dairy farming for twelve years. Her primary income source is milk.

Beatrice stated what is most enjoyable about farming is "milking and digging" and that her biggest challenge is "climate change." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Nyota."

Beatrice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Better service."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required micro-finance training session and she said, "Low interest rate."

Beatrice's highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how the loan will benefit her family, Beatrice replied, "Milking and manure."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Beatrice owns a cow but does not own a pig, poultry, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Diah

texts.en:
Diah is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of silver and natural gemstones for production in time for the holiday season.

Diah has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is her story:

"I was born in Celuk, renowned for its silversmith legacy. When women get married here, we move to the man's house and follow what our husband decides. Luckily, my husband and his parents taught me to design and craft silver jewelry. My designs reflect me and the beauty I find in life. Jewelry to me is about being a woman, and every woman wants to feel beautiful."
