Now Rosario sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 12,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional inputs for farming. She deeply wishes for a good education for her kids and for them to have businesses of their own.

loans.use: To purchase additional inputs for farming.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Amparo is 73 years old, married, and has seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. Amparo runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.  Amparo has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, soft drinks, bread and other groceries. In the future, Amparo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Carmelie

texts.en: Carmelie is 61 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Carmelie requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy material needed for her business.  Carmelie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Carmelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material needed for her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is 49 years old, married, and has four children.  Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more goods, such as bread, soft drinks, spices and other groceries.  Elisa has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.  Elisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store, such as bread, soft drinks, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita  is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that it offers. She is applying for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to pay the rent on space for the retail business. Teresita  dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to pay the rent on retail space.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia lives in Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  She is 45 years old, married and has seven kids. In 2011, she applied for membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing of all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one.  She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pays her loans in a timely manner. 

Recently, she asked for a loan of PHP 23,000 for additional capital for her farming activity.  She plants rice and corn. Through this project, she believes she will be able to raise more income and help the expansion of the business.  Delia has found comfort in their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, for which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and farming tools.

loans.name: Bengy

texts.en:
Bengy is from Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old and is married with one kid. 

In 2010, Bengy applied her membership with PMPC.  Hearing of all the benefits, she did not hesitated to become one. She maintains her status as a member in good standing and repays her loans in a timely manner.

Recently, Bengy is asking for financial assistance in the amount of  PHP 15,000 to purchase farming tools and farm inputs. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and help the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase farming tools and farm inputs.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is 58 years old, married, a resident of Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She earns a living through farming.

She has been a member of PMPC for four years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm inputs and farming tools.

Floreta deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and farming tools

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is widowed, with three children. She is 63 years old and lives in Colambutan Bajo, in the Philippines.

Filomena sells a variety of products to earn a living, and she has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional products, such as vinegar, oil, sauces, salt, sugar, sweets, sardines, noodles, soaps, etc.

Filomena has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, such as vinegar, oil, sauces, salts, sugar, sweets, sardines, noodles, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is married with four children. She is 66 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Virgilia sells banana to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 to purchase additional bananas.

Virgilia has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Virgilia hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas.

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
Alba is widowed and has two children. She is 49 years old and lives in Sinuza, Tudela, in the Philippines.

Alba sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had her business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 1,600 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as breads, biscuits, chocolates, candies, canned goods, noodles, junk foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and other products.

Alba has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Alba hopes to save for future emergencies and support her relatives financially.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as breads, chocolates, canned goods, noodles, beverages, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun is 36 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sugar for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 daily. 

Hoeun asks for a loan of $350 to pay for her son’s study fees. In addition, a part of this money is used to buy school stationery. This money will help her son learn Korean and work in Korea. In the future, she would like to purchase farmland for growing rice and to build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for her son's study fees

loans.name: Louzelin

texts.en:
Louzelin is single with one child. She is 34 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines.

Louzelin sells rice crops to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,900 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers and other agricultural chemicals such as insecticides, pesticides, acaricides, and herbicides.

Louzelin has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Louzelin hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other agricultural chemicals such as insecticides, pesticides, acaricides and herbicides.

loans.name: Luzma

texts.en:
Luzma is married with five children. Luzma  is 45 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Luzma sells snacks and other goods to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,500 to buy additional goods such as biscuits, crackers, chocolates, candies, canned goods, noodles and toothpaste.

Luzma has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Luzma hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods such as biscuits, crackers, chocolates, candies, canned goods, noodles and toothpaste.

loans.name: Melanie Ann

texts.en:
Melanie Ann, age 24, is happy tending her little store.  She is single with one child who is in school. The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  Melanie Ann keeps running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.   Melanie Ann believes that with PMPC's support, as a family they will beat the competition.  

Melanie Ann has been a new member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 30,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there a good education she could afford for her child.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, shampoos, toothpaste and soft drinks.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is single with no children. She is 51 years old and lives in Tinacla-an,Clarin, Philippines.

Milagros is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and agrivet supplies such as medicines and vaccines,etc.

Milagros has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and agrivet supplies such as medicines and vaccines,etc.

loans.name: Charina Rosario

texts.en:
This is Charina Rosario, 45, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, a messenger, and they have children who are all in school. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Charina Rosario is an egg retailer. What she basically does is buy egg from wholesalers and then sells them with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices she offered. She also has a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

Charina Rosario is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 that she will use to purchase additional stocks of eggs. She will also use the loan in buying grocery items and toiletries for her variety store.

Charina Rosario hopes to be successful in life and business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of eggs needed in her business.

loans.name: Roneta

texts.en:
Roneta is 54 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Roneta has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 1,999 each month doing this type of work. Roneta has  requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, baking powder, food coloring and other items.

Roneta has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Roneta would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, baking powder, food coloring and other items.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, es una joven de 24 años vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años en casa propia. Hace un año tuvo la iniciativa de instalar una tienda en su residencia, la cual ella misma atiende todos los días.  
Ella solicita un préstamo para poder surtir más su tienda y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día buscan productos con los que ella no cuenta. Con el capital Sandra comprara jabón, lejía, aceite y azúcar.
Su aspiración es mejorar la atención a los clientes, generar mayores ingresos  y obtener mejores beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 24-year-old young woman who lives with her husband and her 4-year-old son in a house of their own. A year ago, she took the initiative and started a store in her home where she works every day.

She is asking for a loan so that she will be able to stock up her store to a greater capacity. This will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers who daily look for products which she doesn't have. With the money, Sandra will purchase soap, bleach, cooking oil, and sugar. 

She has aspirations to improve customer service, generate greater income, and get better returns for her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, bleach, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida earns a living offering sewing services.  She is 62 years old, separated and lives in Cangbagsa, Larena, Siquijor. She is now well known for the nice quality of services she offers.  She has already made some new clothing and has been able to save money from selling it.  Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 12,000.00 per month.

Aida is seeking a PHP  20,000.00 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items such as a sewing machine, beads and different colors of cloth. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in few  months.  In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency.  Aida is very diligent and loves accuracy which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, cloth and sewing supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old, married and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.

Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of PHP 40,000.00 to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 51 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Teofila works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to acquire additional fishing materials and accessories, namely fishing tackle, a fishing rod, fishing net, fishing gear and other tools.

Teofila has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Teofila hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to acquire additional fishing materials and accessories, namely fishing tackle, a fishing rod, fishing net, fishing gear and other tools.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is widowed with five children. Leonila is 59 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines.

Leonila sells nipa (palm leaf) huts to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to pay for the acquisition of additional local materials used for nipa hut-making such as bamboo, nipa, coconut, different woods and other materials.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Leonila hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of additional local materials used for nipa hut-making such as bamboo, nipa, coconut, and wood.

loans.name: Melesio

texts.es:
Melesio tiene 22 años vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia y es padre de un pequeño de 1 año de edad, al que quiere mucho y por el cual lucha cada día para salir adelante; tal es así que Melesio trabaja para una institución de su ciudad, en la cual labora alrededor de 9 horas al día; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Melesio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar un terreno en el cual más adelante podrá construir su vivienda y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Melesio is 22 years old and lives in the city of Aguaytia. He is the father to a one-year-old, and he fights every day to help his son to get ahead. As such, Melesio works for a company in the city for about nine hours every day. He thinks his work is going very well because he is responsible.

Melesio is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since he will be able to buy a plot of land thanks to the help they've offered him. In the future, he will build a home on this land and be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her degree course validation and her post-graduate studies

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María auxiliadora, es una humilde señora que habita en un barrio marginal de Managua, tiene  a cargo dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 10 años que estudian en un colegio público, su mayor deseo es que ellos sean unos profesionales en la vida. Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante, este es su único medio de ingresos para ambos, con lo que mantienen las necesidades de sus hijos. Solicita este crédito para invertir en su pequeño negocio comprando naranjas, cebollas, tomates, piña, plátanos, limones, con esta inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos para continuar cubriendo los gastos de su hogar y de la familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is a humble lady who lives in the marginal neighborhood of Managua. She has 2 children who she cares for who are 8 and 10 years old. They go to public school. Her greatest desire is that they might be professionals someday. 

She works together with her husband selling fruits and vegetables out of their house and also as street vendors. This is their only way of income to care for the needs of their children. 

She requests this loan to invest in their little business by buying oranges, onions, tomatoes, pineapples, plantains, and lemons. With this investment, she expects to improve her income so that she can continue covering the expenses of their home and family.

loans.use: to buy oranges, onions, tomatoes, pineapple, plantains, lemons.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюда более 25 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. 12 лет назад внезапно умер ее муж. Она осталась с 5 детьми. Она ее дочь инвалид. Долгие годы она была в депрессии после смерти мужа и не приходила в себя. Постепенно дети выросли, и стали ей помогать по домохозяйству. Они находятся в России. Мавлюда в ИМОНе кредитуется 3 раз и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она честная и порядочная женщина. Мавлюда хочет женить сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mavluda has worked with sewing women's clothing for more than 25 years. 12 years ago her husband suddenly died. She was left with five children. One of her daughters is disabled. After her husband's death she was depressed for some long years, and was not herself. 

Gradually her children grew up and started helping her with money the household. They are located in Russia. Mavluda takes a loan from IMON for the third time and has a good credit history. She is an honest and decent woman. 

Mavluda would like to marry her son away, but does not have the money. She requests a loan in the amount of 7,500 somoni for holding a wedding party for her son. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to arrange a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 53 years of age and a resident of Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four kids. They have farming business from which to earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Candelaria and her husband work hard in selling their harvest to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their harvest. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 15,000 loan. They feel assured of Paglaum MPC’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and farming tools.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 65 years old, married and has four children. She lives in Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has been engaged in food production, such as peanut butter and yema candy, for almost eight years and earns a monthly income of 2,500 PHP. 

She requested a new loan as additional capital for her business, so she can sell more to her customers. She wishes to have more savings someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make peanut butter.

loans.name: Carlos Giovanni

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual trabaja como operario de construcción ya que con este humilde empleo puede solventar sus gastos de manutención y con ello salir adelante, Carlos trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy cuidadoso y responsable.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar  mercadería como ropa  con lo cual iniciara su pequeño negocio y poder tener un ingreso extra y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man aged 21 who works as a construction worker. This humble job allows him to pay for his expenses and to forge ahead. Carlos works around 10 hours a day and he believes that it is going well because he is very careful and responsible. 

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their help he will be able to buy merchandise such as clothes, which he will use to open a little business. That way, he will get an additional income and continue struggling to make his greatest dream come true: "To have his own house".

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Айнуры - высшее образование, работает в местной школе преподавателем. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Айнура занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 кобыла, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 1,18 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает перец, картошку, клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Ainura is 37 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Ainura has higher education, and works as a teacher at the local school. As an additional income for her family, Ainura works with livestock breeding, after having started 10 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ainura's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows, a mare, 10 sheep and also a plot of land of 1.18 hectares. Here she grows peppers, potatoes and clover every year. The monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Ainura turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of heifers for increasing the number of cattle. Ainura plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. She also plans to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Sreyda

texts.en:
Sreyda is 31 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, her husband runs a barber shop. He earns about US$12 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Sreyda is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen. This money will help her obtain a better place for cooking. 

In the future, she would like to run general store and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Mirvaidullo

texts.ru: Мирвайдулло 40 лет, женат, имеет двух сыновей. Он со своей семьей проживает в городе Исфара. Его жена работает в школе учительницей начальных классов. Старший сын студент. Он учится во втором курсе Государственного Технического Университета отделения информатики. Младший сын еще учится в школе. Сам Мирвайдулло работает старшим техником в пожарной службе. Одновременно он имеет доход с сада. Мирвайдулло в год с 5 га участка сада собирает 2500 кг яблок, которых после сушки на солнце выводит на продажу. Сейчас Мирвайдулло нуждается в кредите. Ему необходимо оплатить контракт сына за второй курс обучения в Университете. Он очень хочет, чтобы его сын успешно завершил ВУЗ и в будущем стал преподавателем.
texts.en:
Mirvaidullo is 40 years old, married, and has two sons. He lives in the city of Isfara together with his family. His wife works as a primary school teacher. His eldest son is a student. He is in the second year of Computer Science studies at the State Technical University. His youngest son still goes to school. 

Mirvaidullo himself works as a senior technician in the fire department. At the same time he has an income from his garden. He harvests 2500 kilos of apples from his plot of 5 hectares each year, which he sells after drying them in the sun. 

Currently Mirvaidullo needs a loan. He needs to pay tuition for his son's second year of study at the university. He would very much like for his son to complete college and in the future become a teacher.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his son's second year at university

loans.name: Omonjon

texts.ru: Омончон житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 36 лет. Он отец и женатый мужчина. Его родители были фермерами, и он тоже унаследовал их профессию. Омончон большую часть своей жизни провел работая на земле. Он занимается земледелием более 20 лет. Недавно он приобрел орошаемое поле, где еще ранее ничего не сеялось. Омончон хочет обработать землю и посадить картофель. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом, чтобы приобрести семена картофеля. Он очень хочет успеть посадить картошку к осени. Помогите Омончону реализовать его цель.
texts.en:
Omonjon is a resident of the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 36 years old. He is a father and a husband. His parents were farmers, and he followed them in their profession. 

Omonjon spent the larger part of his life working in the field. He has worked with field crop cultivation for more than 20 years. Not long ago he purchased irrigated land, where previously nothing was sown. Omonjon would like to process the land and sow potatoes. For this reason he applied for a loan in order to purchase potato seeds. 

Omonjon would very much like to succeed in sowing potatoes before the fall comes. Help Omonjon realize his dream!

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married, with three children. She is 47 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Leonora is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10  years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and pesticide.

Leonora has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings for her children's education .

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is married with two children. Maribeth is 37 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Maribeth is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide.

Maribeth has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Maribeth hopes to have a rice farm of her own.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with four children. Vilma is 42 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Vilma raises ducks and sell them to customers  to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase various feeds.

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Vilma hopes to have enough savings for her family's future .

loans.use: to pay for various feeds.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 45, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a worker abroad, and they have children. She manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth amount of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 900 in sales every day.

Teresita is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Teresita hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partnersclients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Daniela Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Daniela sigue con la misma actividad dl servicio de copiado de llaves, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra  de distintos modelos de llaves para su negocio,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas que le ayudaran a hacer un buen copiado de llaves,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Daniela continues to do the same work cutting keys.  She tells us that her last loan was used well as she bought different key models for her business.  On this occasion, Daniela is applying for a loan to buy tools that will help her cut keys well.  Daniela is happy and grateful for this opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for cutting keys.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina, se ha decidido por otro crédito para invertir más en su tienda comprara jugos, sodas arroz, frijoles, aceite, maíz, etc. Ella se siente agradecida por la confianza que se le dio anteriormente; administro muy bien su crédito ha hecho crecer su clientela por lo que la demanda que tiene hoy en día es de diversificar los productos que tiene a  la venta.
Cristina con su tienda está generando ganancias que le han ayudado a salir adelante con sus compromisos familiares.
texts.en:
Cristina has decided to apply for another loan in order to invest more in her shop.  She will buy juices, fizzy drinks, rice, beans, oil, corn, and more items.  Cristina feels very grateful for the trust that has previously been put in her.  Cristina manages her loan well and has increased her customer business.  There is now demand to diversify what products she offers.

Cristina is using the shop to generate an income, which has helped her to get ahead and support her family.

loans.use: to buy juices, fizzy drinks, rice, beans, oil, corn, and more items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins for appetite, for the brain, and medicines for the stomach.

loans.name: Hassel

texts.en:
Hassel is 55-years-old and widowed with four children.

Hassel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Hassel has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Hassel aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 20 years old, and she is married. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. 

She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan of US$ 1,000.  She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as traditional clothes. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that it offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothes for her shop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42-years-old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to build a convenience store at the public market.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Jose  tiene 47 años y casado con 2 hijos que son un varon de 7 años y una mujer de 6 años, el se dedica a la producción de zapatos artesanales, como botas, zapatillas de enfermería etc. Su taller se encuentran en Zona Villa Copacabana de la Ciudad de La Paz,  Este préstamo es el Primero que ha tomado de Emprender, Jose va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y material de trabajo para su negocio, además comprará una máquina recta para su negocio. Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo. El Sr.  Jose enfrenta retos en su negocio que son actualmente no cuenta con un taller adecuado para su actividad, ya que depende de otros costureros para terminar su trabajo,  va a utilizar los beneficios Comprara cuero y cuerina al por mayor, lo que disminuirá sus costos, también comprará una máquina recta para su esposa, quién podrá ayudar en el negocio, su deseo para su negocio es hacer construir un ambiente adecuado para su un taller para asi tener toda la maquinaria para realizar un buen trabajo.
texts.en: Mr. Jose is 47 years old and married with two children. His son is 7 years old and his daughter is 6. Jose produces handcrafted shoes such as boots and nursing slippers. His studio is located in the Villa Copacabana zone in the city of La Paz. This is the first loan he has gotten from Emprender. Jose will use this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies and work materials for his business. He will also buy a sewing machine. The reason he is applying for this loan is because he lacks cash. Mr. Jose faces challenges in his business as he currently lacks a suitable workshop and depends on the sewing rooms of others to finish his work. He will use his loan to buy leather and synthetic leather wholesale which will decrease his costs in addition to the purchase of a sewing machine for his wife who can help with the business. His wish for his business is to build a suitable environment for a workshop so he can have all the machinery necessary to do good work.

loans.use: to invest in supplies, materials, and a sewing machine for his business.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
This is Sheryl, 35, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Antonio and they have child. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. They are both working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sheryl operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by pieces. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php700 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php9,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Sheryl dreams to have more customers who will patronize her business and hopes that her child will always be in good health and have a good education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Keo's Group

texts.en:
Keo, 53, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married with four children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and supplement their income by selling snacks. She and her husband have been engaged in this business for 28 years. She is able to earn about 14,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is Keo’s group microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she and her member are first time borrowers. As the leader, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each and she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Ma. Perpetua

texts.en:
Ma. Perpetua works hard to support five children. She is married and has a food selling business in the Philippines.

Ma. Perpetua requested a PHP 4600 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Ma. Perpetua is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una joven madre de 25 años de edad, su pequeño tiene 8 años y cada día trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para poder sacarlo adelante, tal es así que Nancy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, con lo cual tiene un ingreso para poder sacar adelante a su familia, Nancy cree que le va bien porque es muy amable y sobre todo ofrece productos novedosos, asimismo trabaja en un fundo agrícola como obrera con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para los gastos del hogar.

Nancy esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias  a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar más ropa para su negocio y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Nancy is a young 25-year-old mother. Her young child is 8 years old. Every day, she puts in a lot of effort into her work to continue moving forward. She has a small business selling clothes which has given her an income to raise her family. Nancy believes that she is doing well in her business because she is very friendly and, above all, she offers innovative products. She also works on a farm which has provided extra money for household expenses. 

Nancy is grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have provided, she can buy more clothes for her business and improve her income so she can keep fighting to realize her greatest dream: to give her child a professional job.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Nin's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Nin is aged 52 years and widowed. As a widow, she has struggled to feed her two children by farming rice on two-hectares of farmland. Having been in the business for 34 years, the current business earns her approximately 36,100KHR per day. 

Nin has never been with VisionFund and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farm. She hopes to earn more income from her paddy rice so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Tbaung Khmum district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Han is a 59-year-old mother of three children. Rice farming, cassava and rubber planting are the main source of the family’s income which she and her husband have been doing for almost 40 years.

This is the second microloan for Han’s group with Kiva’s partner and they completely paid back the first loan. Han has successfully used the loan to better support her family. Now leading her group to request for a loan, Han,will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of family income so as to increase her income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 48 years old, lives with his wife in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. His elder son got married and lives in Ulaanbaatar on his own. His younger son studies at the university and is now a fourth year student. Jargalsaikhan's wife is unemployed and stays at home looking after the household. He himself has been working as a security officer at a private firm for six years, and before that he worked in a tailoring factory. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay his younger son's tuition fees. He thinks the best thing he can do for his son is to invest in his education which will be useful in his later life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgonbayar, 39 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a tailor workshop for seven years and has accumulated vast amount of experience. Her husband renders taxi service to local people using his automobile. 

As the academic new year came, the order of school uniforms has increased drastically, so she is requesting a loan of 1,900,000 MNT to buy textiles in large amounts from her supplier at wholesale price. By doing so, she will generate significant income, which will be used for living. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual and known for her expertise in making dresses.

loans.use: to buy textiles in large amounts at wholesale price.

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
María; es madre soltera; hace tres años tiene una venta de pupusas y bebidas. Ella inicia su actividad a las tres de la tarde y finaliza a las siete de la noche. Su negocio no le ha presentado ninguna dificultad. Solicita un préstamo para comprar carne, chicharrón, quesillo y bebidas que le servirá para fortalecer más el negocio y así generar mayores ganancias con las cuales  pagará sus cuotas.
Sueña con tener un negocio más grande, tener más clientes satisfechos y brindarle un apoyo económico más estable a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother who has been selling pupusas and drinks for three years. She begins selling at three in the afternoon and ends at seven in the evening. Her business has not presented her with any difficulties. She has applied for a loan to buy beef, pork, cheese, and beverages that will serve to further strengthen her business and generate higher profits with which she can pay her bills. 
She dreams of having a bigger business, having more satisfied customers, and providing more stable financial support to her family.

loans.use: to purchase beef, pork, cheese and beverages.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia, 55, resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, a conductor, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Olivia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Olivia dreams to expand her business that will soon become a supermarket. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zelia

texts.en:
Zelia is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 28-years-old and married.  She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko) hard drink (beer), noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, water, eggs, slippers, fish canes and oil. 

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Zelia is living in a town near the school and her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use:
to buy soft drinks (Fanta, Coca 
Cola, Sprite, Sagiko) hard drink (beer), noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, water, eggs and slippers.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is 42-year-old lady who is living with her son and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is lathe turner by profession and manufactures spare parts for vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture the spare parts of various vehicles. His lathe machine has become out of order due to continuously working and needs maintenance. He has spend all of his savings to buy cast iron for manufacturing spare parts and does not have money left to fix the lathe machine.

Therefore, Ishrat requested a loan for her husband so that he could fix the deficiencies of his lathe machine. She is tension free now because she hopes that her husband can easily operate his lathe machine again. Ishrat is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenance of a lathe machine.

loans.name: Chogdoo

texts.en: Mr. Chogdoo, 54 years old, lives with his wife in an old house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a carpenter for three years since he retired from work. All of his three children live separately on their own. The house Chogdoo and his wife live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair, so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his old house. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and will release less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He used it in his business, which is a junk shop, and it is continuously growing. He also used it in the education of his children. All of his children are in school; two are in high school and one is in grade school. He used his income from business to pay for their everyday expenses at home. His wife is very supportive of him and helping him manage their household and business.

He would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan. He will be incorporating the loan on his current revolving fund used to buy scrap materials. His profits from his business will definitely help him sustain their daily needs and education expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jerry hopes that his business will grow bigger, and dreams that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his fellowship* co-members to share stories of his work every week, and he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, se decidió por otro crédito por que le ha resultado un recurso muy importante para mejorar su negocio; comprara maíz, harina, aceite, etc., todo lo necesario para elaborar diferentes antojitos. Con el préstamo anterior Doris incremento sus ganancia, amplio su negocio, también ha ganado más popularidad entre sus clientes, los cuales se sienten satisfechos por su buen servicio.
Ha  mejorado su estabilidad económica y de esa forma las condiciones de vida que le da a su familia son mejores. Desea seguir con su negocio para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en: Doris decided to request another loan because her previous loan was a very important resource for improving her business.  She will buy corn, flour, oil, and other things she needs to make various corn-based dishes.  With the previous loan, Doris increased her earnings, expanded her business, and has also become more popular with her customers, who feel satisfied with the service she provides.  She has improved her financial stability and this gives her family a better quality of life.  Doris wants to continue with her business to support her children in school.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Sumaaira's Group

texts.en:
Sumaaira is a 31-year-old lady, living with her spouse and 4 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother. Her 2 children are young and fully dependent upon their parents. She wants to make some savings so that she could provide better facilities for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw with problems for many years, because most of the time his rickshaw remains out of order. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw but his earnings and savings do not allow him to do this. 

Therefore, Sumaaira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to repair the auto rickshaw so that he could drive it without problems. She hopes that her husband will be able to generate reasonable income and she would be able to make some savings.
Sumaaira says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa is 30 years of age and married with two dependent children, one of whom is in the primary school level of education. She and her husband are rice farmers operating on a few pieces of their own farmland, which is not too far from their house, located in Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province.

They always wish they could manage their rice farming business to have a better yield, and thereby generate a higher income from the business. They are doing their best to attain this wish.

To help her achieve her dream of having an abundant harvest, Sa wanted to acquire a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to buy fertilizers for the sustenance of their farm and cover other costs of farming. 

She hopes that the loan will have a positive impact on her farming business. With the income she expects to make from the farming business as a result of the loan, she plans to save it for the purchase of an additional farm to expand her crop production. 

Thanks lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the sustenance of their farm and cover other costs of farming.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 45-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children.

She has taken a loan for her husband’s rickshaw. In fact, his rickshaw is in need of repair due to continuous work. He earns very low money, which is insufficient to meet his daily household expenses. 

Najma belongs to a poor family. Her husband is an old man but he is contributing to the household expenses. Her three sons are doing jobs in different companies; they are also contributing to the household expenses.

Najma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can fix his rickshaw and drive it smoothly.
 
She wants marry of her daughter and is making savings. She hopes that this loan will affect her savings also. 

Najma says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
This is Chona, 36, a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. Her husband is Efren, a worker abroad and they have children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Chona operates a general merchandise store. What she basically does is buy different items such as accessories, toys, school supplies, and beauty products from wholesalers and sell them per piece/pack for a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy different items such as accessories, toys, school supplies and beauty products needed in her store.
 
Chona hopes that her business will grow bigger and have another branch. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different items such as toys, school supplies, accessories and beauty products needed in her store.

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean is 47 years old and a resident living in her own house in Prey Chor district of Kampong Cham province. She is happily married and has given birth to five children. To earn a living, she and her husband have owned and managed a rice farming business for more than 30 years. She has gained valuable experience in her farming practices and is sure to maintain high crop production each harvest season.

Chhean wants to buy farm supplies to improve the growth of her rice crop, but she is experiencing financial difficulty nowadays. For this reason, she has requested a loan of KHR 2,000,000 from Kiva lenders. Through applying complete farming supplies and her perseverance, she can have a plentiful harvest this coming crop season. She hopes that her dreams will be attained in order to sustain her family's needs and educate all of her children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to improve the growth of her rice crop.

loans.name: Azjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Azjargal, 37 years old, lives with her mother and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a brick house on a plot of land. She has been working as an attorney and giving legal advice to local people since 2003. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

As winter comes closer, her family is concerned with their brick house, which has deteriorated over the years and needs some renovation. For this cause, she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass and foam. As a result, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the air. Azargal is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass and foam

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek is 63 years old and married with 6 children. He lives happily with his family in his own house located in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province.  Ek has been dedicated to an agricultural business for many years. He mentioned that he is a simple farmer but he is proud, because through his farming business he is able to provide enough food for his family and support his children during their school days.

Since his family is experiencing difficulties accessing transportation, he has returned to HKL for his third loan, with which he aims to buy a motorcycle for serving the household with their transportation needs. He knows that his loan request will have a great impact in improving his living conditions. For his future plan, he wants to have another loan opportunity from lenders to invest in expanding his farming business by purchasing extra farmland and animals for farming. This will enable him to improve his financial stability and uplift his family out from poverty. He thanks lenders for this constant support. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for serving the household with their transportation needs.

loans.name: Charmaine Marie

texts.en:
Charmaine Marie has joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she appreciates the co-op's programs, services and continuous education. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the co-op offers.

She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos This loan is intended for additional stock of canned goods, rice, soft drinks and other goods for her sari-sari (general store).

Charmaine Marie dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of canned goods, rice, soft drinks and other goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Fe Ruina

texts.en:
Fe Ruina is married, with two children.  She runs a general store in the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City. 

Aside from this, she has also engaged with her Video K business to make a living. To improve her business, she borrowed PHP 10,000 from GDMPC microcredit to repair her Video K machine for a better entertainment service. 

She hopes to expand her business using the profit she earns from this loan and to be able to sent her children to school and finish their studies.

loans.use: to repair her Video K machine for a better entertainment service

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays daily fair because this rickshaw does not belonging to him. He belongs to the ultra poor family, and has been feeding his 6 children. Now, his children are growing old and their needs are growing as well. He was worried for many days about how to abstain from the daily fair, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Samina has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing, some money remained short.
Therefore, Samina requested a loan for her husband so he can buy the new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.
   
Samina is a 33-year-old woman, living with her 6 children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that now her husband will be able to have more income because now he will not pay a daily fair to anyone.
 
Samina was very happy after taking this loan, and says thanks to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married and lives in a town with her family. She is being offered a $1,000 loan to improve her business. 

Josefina opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital. She is generating a good income from selling fuel. She will use this loan to buy stock, such as gasoline, kerosene and diesel, to keep in her store. 

She has been thinking about running a big business after years of involving herself in business.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, kerosene and diesel

loans.name: Shabano

texts.en:
Shabano is a 30-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives a rickshaw in Lahore city which is a very populated area. A few days ago he got into a road accident. He was standing beside the road to find a passenger when a speeding car crashed into the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any physical fractures but the rickshaw body got seriously damaged and needs to be replaced with a new one. Her husband has some amount short to buy a new body for his auto rickshaw.

Shabano requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a new body for the auto rickshaw. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honor.

loans.use: to buy a new body for her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida has taken a loan for her husband, who drives a chingchi rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is not powerful, so it is used only to cover short distances. Its body is made with polyester which is not enough strong to bear jerks over the roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles during driving. 

Zahida is a 38-year-old lady, living with her husband and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a chingchi rickshaw body. She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings until her young children are grown, and that she would be successful in providing higher education to her children. 

Zahida says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a body for a Chingchi rickshaw.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra belongs to what is classified as an ultra-poor family. 

She lives with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures the iron accessories used in houses and on doors and windows. He has been providing services for making iron doors and windows, and for repairing broken accessories, with the help of a welding plant.

A few days ago, Bushra's husband's welding plant became out of order due to overheating. He wants to buy a new welding plant but does not have the money to do so, due to having a lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is an active Kiva field partner. The loan will enable her husband to buy a welding plant for manufacturing metal goods.  

Bushra says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding plant for manufacturing metal goods.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 67-year-old married father of two children. He is a Palestinian refugee living and working in Lebanon. Mohamad is a plumber. He is very skilled in his field because of his 40 years of experience. Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay his son’s university fees. 

Mohamad is the family’s sole breadwinner. He works hard to develop his business and expand it as much as he can to make sure that it provides enough to cover his family’s needs and requests. Mohamad’s future plan is to continue expanding and improving his work by completing a variety of construction projects that provide him with a higher income.

loans.use: to pay his son’s university fees

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald lives in the Litein area of Kenya, a very green and fertile land. He has three children and has been doing this work for four years. His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

For Ronald, what is most enjoyable about farming is rearing dairy cows. His biggest challenge is not having enough capital. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Ronald was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "It gives low interest rates on loans." This client was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. He said, "They are key for our economic development."

Ronald's highest monthly expenses are farming costs. He said this loan will benefit his family by increasing its sources of income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ronald owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. In his household, Ronald has a mosquito net, solar power and a sewing machine but he does not have electricity, running water, a TV or DVD player.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has five children and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and transportation services.

Jonah stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is "horticultural farming." His biggest challenge is "lack of funds." Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Jonah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "it's easy to access." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required micro-finance training session and he said, "They help us with funds in an easy way." Jonah's highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how the loan will benefit his family, Jonah replied, "Increase sources of income."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jonah owns a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, and running water, but does not have electricity, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 13, 6 y 5 años; dos de ellos asisten a la escuela, es una persona muy reconocida por luchar para salir adelante.
Desde hace 25 años se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias (crianza de ganado y siembra de granos básicos) negocio que aprendió de sus padres, sus labores empiezan a las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m., invertirá en la compra de 6 quintales de abono para la siembra de maíz y así tener una cosecha abundante que le generara mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es tener recursos para para darle a su familia mejor alimentación, una vivienda más amplia y sobre todo que sus hijos tengan una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Victor is married and lives with his wife and three children, aged 13, 6, and 5 years old respectively.  The children are all attending school.  Victor is well-know for fighting in order to prosper.

For 25 years Victor has worked in agriculture (cattle raising and growing basic grains).  He learned this business from his parents.  Victor works from 6am until 3pm.  He will invest this loan in six hundredweights of manure for his corn crops.  This will give him an abundant harvest that will generate a high income.  

Victor's dream is to have the resources to feed his family better, to have a larger house and, above all, to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy six hundredweights of manure.

loans.name: Rafail

texts.ru: Рафаилю 61 год. Он с женой живет в Спитаменском районе. Его жена пенсионерка, а он сам работает в Новсельмаше - это цех по вырабатыванию арматуры. Одновременно он арендует 1 га участок земли, где выращивает кукурузу. У Рафаиля есть дети, но они живут отдельно от них. Рафаилю и его жене помогает дочь, которая не далеко живет. В данный момент Рафаиль хочет начать новый бизнес по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Животноводством он намерен заняться дома у дочери. Его дочь совершенно не против и всячески помогает отцу. Рафаиль нуждается в кредите, чтобы закупить 4 голов коровы. Он собирается откормить их в течение 90 дней и перепродать на местном рынке. У него имеется машина для перевозки. Он просит финансирование для начала бизнеса. Он ждет вашу поддержку!
texts.en: Rafail is 61 years old.  He and his wife live in the Spitamen area.  His wife collects a pension and he works at Novselmash - a plant that manufactures fittings.  At the same time they rent a 1 acre plot of land where they grow corn.  Rafail has children but they live apart from him.  His daughter who lives nearby helps Rafail and his wife.  Right now, Rafail would like to start a new business to fatten and sell cattle.  He will raise livestock at his daughter's home.  His daughter is not opposed at all and helps her father in many ways.  Rafail needs a loan to purchase 4 heads of cattle.  He plans to fatten them over a period of 90 days and to resell them at the local market.  He has a car for transport.  He is asking for a loan to start his business.  He looks forward to your support!

loans.use: to start a new business feeding and selling cattle

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is the group leader and is taking the responsibility for her group members. This is Zarina's first loan. She assured us that she will pay all installments on time because she wants to take another loan in the future.
 
Zarina is a 56 year old married woman, who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is requesting a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. Her husband owns a fruit shop. He likes to sell seasonal fruits, and now he wants to buy bananas in large quantity because their season is going on and their price is very low. Zarina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband could buy the bananas in large quantity. Zarina hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business and that she will save a reasonable amount soon.

Zarina is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell in shop.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach, aged 45, is a farmer who lives with her children in a public gathering area of Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. She has been in this occupation for more than 30 years and rice farming is the sole source of her family’s income. With the income generated from the harvested crop, she was able to provide daily meals and allowance for her children.

Mach has applied for a loan of 1,000 US dollars in order to buy a motorcycle, which will be used to serve as transportation for one of her children to commute to work. This motorcycle will facilitate in their transportation needs and reduce unwanted expenses for taxi on a monthly basis. She thanks lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle, which will be used to serve as transportation for one of her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Maiwa

texts.en:
Maiwa lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has two children and has been doing this work for four years. His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

Maiwa stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is "breeding dairy cows" and that his biggest challenge is "diseases." Animals on the farm have not been given names.

Maiwa was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Faster in loan processing." He was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required micro-finance training session, and he replied, "They are aimed at improving our lives."

Maiwa's highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how the loan will benefit his family, Maiwa replied, "Help in generation of more capital to educate my children."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Maiwa owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. In his household, this borrower has a mosquito net, solar power, and running water, but does not have electricity, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Asylkan

texts.ru: Асылкан 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Асылкан- средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Асылкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Асылкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 1 кобыла, 1 жеребенок, 30 овец, также имеет земельный надел, мерою 1,28 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивают картошку, фасоль и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асылкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Асылкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадебное мероприятие сына.
texts.en:
Asylkan is 51 years old, married and, along with her husband, is raising three children. Asylkan has vocational training, and has been involved in livestock production as her main source of income, starting with one cow that she purchased 20 years ago for 5,000 Kyrgyzstani som (KGS). Thanks to Asylkan's hard work, her farm now contains two cows, one horse, one mare, one colt, 30 sheep and a 1.28 hectare plot of land that each year produces potatoes, beans and perennial grasses. Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS).  

With the goal of expanding her farm, Asylkan has turned to microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows for cattle breeding. With the income from the loan, Asylkan plans to invest in growing the number of cattle on her farm, and plans to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia, 26, is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $50. She earns a good income from her business.

Leonia will use this loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, noodles, eggs, water, milk, coffee, sugar and salt. She is a very hardworking woman. Running her business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. 

In the future, she wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, noodles, eggs, water, milk, coffee, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
Akil is a 37-year-old single man, who is financially responsible for one member of his family. He sells cars for a living, with two years of experience in his domain, but his good reputation provides him with support and recommendations from his customers.
Akil is very cautious about his business and cars; he works hard to keep his business up to date and to be more productive. For this reason, Akil is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy new car accessories, which will attract customers and meet their needs.
His future plans are to expand his business through increasing the number of cars he owns and to open a bigger showroom.

loans.use: to buy new car accessories

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and is very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP. This loan is intended to purchase additional stocks for her buy and sell business.
