Mercy dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and to make an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Donabel

texts.en:
Donabel joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative this year and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.
She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5000. This loan is intended to purchase bananas, sugar, cassava and gallons of oil for food vending.
Donabel dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her  business.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, sugar, cassava and gallons of oil for food vending.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 38-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good and the living standard seems not for humans. She wants to establish her house and change the living standard of her family. Her whole family is depending upon a single earning person. Her husband drives a rickshaw which is their single source of income.
Her husband is getting a new auto rickshaw from a rickshaw maker, he has almost made the whole rickshaw but the body structure is left to be made. 
Therefore, Yasmeen taking the loan for her husband so that he could complete the remaining body structure of his auto rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her husband, so that he could drive his new rickshaw and get income for her family. 
Yasmeen hopes that her husband will have a stable profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. 
Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new body for an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, a 52-year-old married mother of five children, has made a living through the operation of a retail store, selling a variety of food and home-use products. She has been in this business for more than four years to make a living. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC that was used in her business, was successfully repaid. She has borrowed a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items, such as canned goods, soy sauce, cooking oil, noodles and sugar to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: restock her general store.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Litein area of Kenya. His primary income sources are milk and eggs. He has five children and has been doing this work for four years. 

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “mixed farming”. His biggest challenge is “animal diseases”. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Paul was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, “Provides loans with low interest rates.”  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which he replied, “They help us acquire income-generating assets.”

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?, Paul replied, “(I) will buy poultry so that (my) children do not sleep hungry.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paul owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, and running water, but does not have electricity, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
A loan of $600 is offered to Adelina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come everyday to buy her products. 

She will buy some additional supplies, such as sugar, coffee, salt, eggs, water, noodles, Fanta, Coca-Cola and cigarettes. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Adelina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, salt, egg, water, noodles, Fanta, Coca-Cola and cigarettes.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has three children and has been doing this work for three years. Her primary income source is milk.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Dairy cow farming.' Her biggest challenge is 'Animal diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Cathrine was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'it is friendly and accessible.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They are good for economy.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family.', Cathrine replied 'Improve livelihoods.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Cathrine owns the following: 'cow, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: to construct a green house.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 42 years old. Shehnaz took this loan for the business of her husband. Her husband purchases scrap goods and sells it to the scarp market. In fact, he purchases scrap goods such as iron, plastic and aluminum from his locality, categories it and sells it to the relevant scrap market.
 
Due to an increase in the family's expenses, he wants to grow his purchasing power so that he can sell scrap in large quantities and can get maximum income than previously. Therefore, Shehnaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Through the loan, her husband will be able to buy more scrap material to sell.
 
Shehnaz says thanks to Kiva and will be tension free because her husband does not have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Serakazi Group

texts.en:
Jackson, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children, a boy and a girl, who are in school. Since 2003, Jackson has been running two businesses. One is a cafe and the other is a tailor and clothes shop. He works from 6am to 9pm each working day, and is able to make a very good profit each month. 

This will be his 6th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loans to open a fruit and vegetables business which closed, and then he open a cafe. Jackson also bought more fabrics for his tailoring business and has paid back all his previous loans successfully. With the business profit received, he will pay for school fees, household expenses and build a house. Jackson will use this loan to buy more drinks for his cafe and more fabrics for tailoring. He dreams that one day will be able to expand his businesses by open another better one. 

He will share this loan with his loan group" Serakazi" which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for his cafe and more fabrics for tailoring.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been transporting students of a particular high school from their homes to school for ten years. Her husband is a carpenter and crafts and sells wooden products. Their two children are both students at university. 

This summer, she and her husband began to repair their old house by dismantling its roof and windows as well as some walls. But due to finance, they couldn't finish their renovation, so she is requesting a loan of 4,700,000 MNT to buy necessary planks, shingles, vacuum insulated windows, as well as an iron door. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the oncoming winter. Also they will begin burning less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase planks, windows and door to renovate her house.

loans.name: Laylanie

texts.en:
Laylanie is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She used her loan in her variety store to buy more grocery items. Her loan is also being used for the education expenses of her children. She used the income of her loan in their household needs and expenditures. She and her husband, who works abroad, are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Laylanie hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from studing the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 33-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Since 2006, her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidery by machine in his nearby town. He has been recruiting workers for embroidery work on daily wages. He is very expert in his profession. He aslo knits bridal dresses, and people like him for his arts and appreciate his efforts. Now, the marriage season is going to start with lots of demand. He wants to cope with the demand for bridal dresses, which is why he wants to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.
 
Rehana requires some capital to buy the desired inventories for her husband, but she does not have a sufficient amount. So she made a humble request to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan her husband would be able to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Rehana is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy pearls, sequins, and threads of various colors.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is a 53-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and grandson in a small village of Martvili district. Meri has 20 hens and sells eggs. In addition, the family owns agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. Meri sells the harvested nuts seasonally. 

Meri has requested a loan to purchase a cow. The Start Up program,which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo. enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL for purchasing a cow. As the cow is purchased, she will milk it every day and start producing dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of her family, and with increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Pascaline est une femme de 49 ans veuve mère d'un enfant de 26 ans qui va encore à l'école.  Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (banannes, plantains) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 20 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un camion des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pascaline is a 49-year-old woman who is the widowed mother of a 26-year-old child  still attending school. She is a merchant and for the past 20 years has been retailing fresh seasonal produce (bananas and plantains) in one of the local markets.

She has a good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her customers that she has acquired over time, given her experience in this field.

However, she finds herself constantly out of stock because she is forced to sell all of her stock before she can resupply, due to her limited working capital.

She would like to buy a truckload of plantain bunches to have a good stock supply, that will enable her to better meet the constant demand of her customers and avoid being out of stock.

She intends to save her profits, not only to expand her activity but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: buy a truckload of bananas and plantains

loans.name: Ramata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois est inauguré ce 26 septembre 2013. Il regroupe des femmes qui partagent des liens de solidarité très solide du fait de leur compagnonnage pendant plus de cinq bonnes années soit 11 cycles. Les membres sont désireux de développer des activités génératrices de revenus ainsi améliorer les conditions d’existence facilitant l’accès aux produits de consommation courante. Ces femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, elles pratiquent aussi la culture sous pluies.

Madame Ramata, âgée de 28 ans (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Malgré son jeune âge elle demeure très active dans la vie de son groupement. Elle est revendeuse de produits alimentaires plus particulièrement le sucre et le thé vert accompagné de divers autres produits tels que les bonbons et biscuits pour enfants.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter du sucre un sac ou un ½, de l’huile de palme et divers autres produits.
 
Avec  les bénéfices, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group was inaugurated on 26 September 2013. It regroups women who share very strong ties of solidarity because of their more than five years' companionship, or 11 loan cycles.

Group members are eager to develop income-generating activities and improve their living conditions, which facilitates their access to basic consumer goods. These women's main activity is to run small businesses. They also grow crops in the rainy season.

Mrs. Ramata, aged 28 (standing at the far right), is the featured borrower of this group. Despite her young age, she is quite active in the life of her group. She retails food products, especially sugar, green tea, as well as various other products such as sweets and biscuits for children.

With the new loan, she will buy a bag or a half-bag of sugar, palm oil and various other products.

With the profits she intends to support her husband in managing family expenditures.

loans.use: buy a bag of sugar or ½, oil palm and various other products.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as gasoline, kerosene and diesel. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Amelia is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, kerosene and diesel.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 47-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two sons in Mtskheta district. Her husband is a physical worker and gets orders for different types of jobs to earn money. Nino is a nurse at local hospital and earns 200 GEL (Georgia lari) per month. In addition, she bakes cakes, and from this work, she gets 250 GEL per month. 

Nino is a very hardworking woman and she decided to run her own business. The family has a commercial space, where she is going to open a grocery store. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,300 GEL for purchasing stock of groceries. As the grocery store is opened, the income of the family will rise and become stable.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois est inauguré ce 26 septembre 2013. Il regroupe des femmes qui partagent des liens de solidarité très solide du fait de leur compagnonnage pendant plus de cinq bonnes années soit 11 cycles. Les membres sont désireux de développer des activités génératrices de revenus ainsi améliorer les conditions d’existence facilitant l’accès aux produits de consommation courante. Ces femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, elles pratiquent aussi la culture sous pluies.

 Madame Aida, âgée de 41 ans (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants un garçon et une fille. Son activité s’inscrit dans l’achat et la revente de légumes, huile de palme et de poissons secs qu’elle achète auprès de femmes transformatrices pour le poisson par panier et de femmes maraichers pour les légumes.

  Avec son nouveau prêt, elle prévoit d’acheter ½ panier de poissons secs, 20 litres d’huile de palme et des légumes pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices lui  permettront d’aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de consommation de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group was inaugurated on 26 September 2013. It regroups women who share very strong ties of solidarity because of their more than five years' companionship, or 11 loan cycles.

Group members are eager to develop income-generating activities and improve their living conditions, which facilitates their access to basic consumer goods. These women's main activity is to run small businesses. They also grow crops in the rainy season.

Mrs. Aida, 41 years old (standing on the far right) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl.

Her activity is to purchase and retail vegetables, palm oil and dried fish. She buys the baskets of fish from women who process them and the vegetables from women producers.

She plans to use her new loan to buy half a basket of dried fish, 20 liters of palm oil and vegetables for retail sales.

The profits will enable her to help her husband provide for the family's consumption.

loans.use: purchase half a basket of dried fish, 20 liters of palm oil and vegetables for retail sales.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say is 35 years old and married with six single children. She has a permanent address in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She owns and operates a farming business, which she learned from her parents and has continued to work up to now. She sows rice, cassava and vegetables on around 3 hectares of farmland. This happens two or three times a year.

With the loan amounting to 1,000,000 KHR (Cambodian riels), Say will hire people to weed her cassava plantation. This way she can allow her crops to grow quickly without any challenges caused by weed plants. With this investment her production will be greater, and she hopes to receive better income in this coming harvest season. Thanks to lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to hire people to weed her cassava plantation.

loans.name: Bat-Orshih

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Orshih, 37 years old, lives with his wife, two daughters and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2009, and during the wintertime, he helps his wife in making leather gloves. They together sell their leather gloves to retailers in the market. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy leather in a large amount. As a result, he and his wife can continue to make and sell leather gloves to retailers at the market. This is the business that carries them through the winter.

loans.use: to buy leather in a large amount for making gloves.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en: Gia is a 39-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and daughter in a small village in the Kvareli district. His wife trades in clothing and earns 200-250 GEL per month. His daughter is an invalid and gets a pension of 70 GEL per month for medicine. Gia is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a 0.35 hectare of land where he grows maize to sell. In addition, Gia has a horse and brings wood from the forest by horse to sell. As the existing income is not enough for the family, Gia requested a loan to purchase two cows. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 4000 GEL to purchase cows. As the cows are purchased, they will start producing dairy products to sell. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Rocky's Group

texts.fr:
Créer ce 18 septembre 2013 à l’occasion de son inauguration dans la place publique du village, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes déterminées à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu et de renforcer leur capacité de financement. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce.

Madame Rocky (en médaillon vers le haut et à droite), l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée 44 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 filles et 02 garçons. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de produits alimentaires à savoir : le riz, l’huile raffinée, le thé vert, …. Qu’elle achète dans un marché hebdomadaire de la sous région pour la revente par détail.

Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter deux sacs de riz de 50 kilos à 12 500 F CFA l’unité, 01 sac de sucre en poudre de 50 kilos à 20 000 F CFA et du thé vert pour 5 000 F CFA.

Elle utilisera les bénéfices à soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Created on September 18, 2013 at its inauguration in the public square of the village, this "banc villageois" loan group comprises women determined to undertake income-generating activities and strengthen their financial capabilities. They have lived in the same village for decades and maintain relations of solidarity and mutual aid. They are active in running small businesses.

Mrs. Rocky (in the inset and sitting to the right), is the group's featured borrower. She is 44 years old, married and mother of four children including two girls and two boys.

Her business is to retail food products namely: rice, refined oil, green tea. She buys in one of the sub-region's weekly markets for subsequent retail sales.

With this new loan, she intends to buy two 50-kilo bags of rice at 12,500 CFA francs each, one 50-kilo bag of powdered sugar at 20,000 CFA francs and green tea for 5,000 CFA francs.

She will use the profits to assist her husband in managing the children's schooling.

loans.use: buy two 50-kilo bags of rice at 12,500 CFA francs each, one 50-kilo bag of powdered sugar at 20,000 CFA francs and green tea for 5,000 CFA francs

loans.name: Fatou Modou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois Nouvellement inauguré, ce 26 septembre 2013 est composé de femmes soucieuses d’apporter un changement dans leurs conditions d’existence raison pour la quelle elles ont intégré le programme des bancs villageois. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Fatou, âgée de 36 ans (debout à l’extrême gauche), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est vendeuse de légumes frais dans un marché hebdomadaire de la sous région. Elle achète son produit auprès de maraichers pour la plus part de son village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte se procurer au moins 06 planches de salades et quels que seaux concombres pour la revente au détail et par tas.

Avec  les bénéfices, elle veut développer son activité et participer de manière active à la gestion des charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group, newly inaugurated on September 26, 2013, comprises women committed to changing their living conditions, which is why they have integrated the "banc villageois" loan program. They have lived in the same village for decades and maintain relations of solidarity and mutual aid. They are active in running small businesses.

Fatou, 36 years old (standing on the far left), is the group's featured borrower. She sells fresh produce in one of the sub-region's weekly markets. She buys her products from vegetable producers, mostly from her village.

With the new loan, she intends to buy at least 06 platters of salads and a few buckets of cucumbers for retail sales or by lot.

She wants to use her profits to expand her business and actively participate in managing family expenditures.

loans.use: buy at least six platters of salads and a few buckets of cucumbers for retail sales or by lot

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 39-year-old married mother of four children. She works as a tailor at her house to help her husband in making their living and covering their beloved family’s increasing expenses. Abir is a hard worker with eighteen years of experience in her domain. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new updated multifunction tailoring machine which decreases time and provides a better quality of produced items.

In the meantime, she is not financially capable of opening a separate tailoring shop outside her house, but it’s a dream she hopes will come true for her future plans.

loans.use: to buy a new updated multifunction tailoring machine which decreases time and provides a better quality of produced items.

loans.name: Akper

texts.en: Akper is a 55-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren in a small village in the Marneuli district. His wife is a teacher at a local school and gets 350 GEL per month. Akper is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a greenhouse where tomatoes are grown. He works hard to insure a good harvest, which is sold to local retailers. As the income is not enough for such a big family, Akper decided to request a loan to purchase a cow. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2000 GEL to purchase a cow. As the cow is purchased, the family will start producing dairy products and they will be able to increase the income of their family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Anin

texts.en:
Anin is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as books, pans, oils, body lotion, coffee, sugar, salt, breakfast items, cigarettes and shampoo. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. 

Anin is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy books, pans, oils, body lotion, coffee, sugar, salt, cigarettes and shampoo to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 36 years old and the mother of three daughters.
 
Her husband is a manufacturer; he manufactures plastic toys over a molding machine. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic toys and plastic accessories as per contracts. He appointed labourers over molding machines on daily wages. In this way, he is also helping unemployed people in his region. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs raw materials of different categories and qualities. Recently, he made a huge contract with a manufacturing company for making plastic accessories. For this is reason he needs crushed plastic raw materials in large quantities. Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy crushing plastic raw materials for manufacturing. 

Through his profits, her husband will increase the daily wages of his workers, make some savings and look after his children in a better way. Nusrat is very happy after taking this loan, and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crushed plastic raw materials for manufacturing through a molding machine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is single but has a big determination to be successful in his mango farm business. He joined GDMPC this year and borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase herbal organic spray like concentrate and powder. With this small amount of investment, he is hopeful to have an abundant harvest that will help him to save for his better future.

loans.use: to purchase herbal organic spray like concentrate and powder for his mango farm.

loans.name: Jee-Ann

texts.en: Jee-Ann is married with three children and resides in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is a teacher while her husband works as a provincial driver. Aside from their salary, she manages their own farm planting corn as under cropping of the coco farm to make a living. She borrowed a loan of 40,000 PHP to cover the costs of farm plowing and to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. She is determined to give her children a better future, so with this investment, a portion of the profit gained will be saved for their education.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm plowing and to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joveflor

texts.en: Joveflor is married with only one child. She manages her own farm located in Cabungaan, Clarin. Misamis Occidental where the family resides. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her coconut farm. With this investment, Joveflor is assured to gain an abundant harvest in the future. She wants to have a better living situation with her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her coconut farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married. She is running a business in her house selling noodles, fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, beer, water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and bread. She is making a good income from selling things, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy things and she is selling them every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $200.

loans.use: To buy noodles, fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, beer, water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and bread

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A loan of $600 is offered to Maria to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come every day to buy from her. She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, salt, noodles and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Maria independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt and noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Aliona

texts.en:
Aliona is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Aliona is currently unemployed. Her husband works on renovations and gets 250 GEL per month. 

As the existing income is not enough for her family, Aliona decided to request a loan and start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $ 700. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothing from the wholesalers and then start trading. This will increase her income and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to begin trading with clothing.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, aged 58, and resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Fernando, a worker, and they have children. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Nida operates a repacking business. What she basically does, is buy different products from wholesalers, repacks them and sell them for a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy different products such as pepper, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate and other products for repacking.

Nida hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different products such as pepper, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate and other products for repacking.

loans.name: Doch

texts.en:
Doch is 52-years-old and is a hardworking woman who always seeks for ways to generate more income and uplift her family’s living conditions. She is happily married to a noble man and has eight children; five of whom have already settled in marriage. She wants to earn consistent profit from her farming business in order to cover her daily living costs, so she works hard in her rice paddy fields and has saved some money to expand her rice production in the future.

To help improve production, she needs additional capital to provide enough farming supplies for her rice crop. She will buy sacks of fertilizers and pesticides. This loan will allow her to maintain the good condition of her crop and be able to have a higher profit after collecting and selling her harvest in the markets. She appears in the photo with her husband, a rice farmer.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en: Mr. Baatar is 46-years-old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering a taxi service to local people since 2011 and begins his service at 7 am and finishes at 9 pm. His wife is an officer of the state register authority. His eldest daughter studies at university while the youngest one goes to kindergarten. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to pay his daughter's tuition fees. He thinks investing in his daughter's education is the best thing he can do for her.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for different products such as peppers, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products for her repacking business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is aged 34 years and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and is passing her life very smooth and calmly. 
Her husband owns a canteen in the school; he offers canteen items such as burgers, samosas, finger chips, ketchup, salad, rice, cold drinks, and juices. The students like to eat spicy food at recess time; he is earning sufficient income to feed his family.  After the school timing, he is unable to sell his items because his canteen is inside the school, so he wants to open a burger point near his house, but he does not have savings to buy burgers, salad, ketchup, eggs, and a stall to offer burgers to common persons. 

Therefore, Shazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy burgers, salad, ketchup, eggs, and a stall. Shazia hopes that this burger point will work very well and will be the cause of increase in income. Shazia says thank you to Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan's team.

loans.use: To buy burgers, spices, eggs, salad, and ketchup for her husband's food cafe business.

loans.name: Tacko's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois Nouvellement inauguré, ce 26 septembre 2013 est composé de femmes soucieuses d’apporter un changement dans leurs conditions d’existence raison pour la quelle elles ont intégré le programme des bancs villageois. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce. 

Madame Tacko, âgée de 47 ans (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 garçons. C’est une femme très dynamique et a beaucoup contribuer dans la mise en place du banc villageois. Elle tient une table au village où  elle vend divers produits alimentaires à savoir le sucre, le thé vert, des condiments et différentes marques de cigarettes.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle prévoit d’acheter en gros un sac de sucre, trois cartons de 10 paquets de cigarette et le reste une variété d’assaisonnement.

Les bénéfices lui  permettront de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
This newly inaugurated village bank, on 26 september 2013, is made up of women who joined this bank as they are concerned about bringing about change in their living conditions. They have all lived in the same village for several decades, and have strong ties of solidarity among them. They are all involved in small businesses.
Mrs Tacko, 47 years old (seen standing at the far right with her hand raised in the photo above) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of two boys. She is very dynamic and contributed tremendously to the establishment of the village bank. She has a table in the village from which she sells various food products such as sugar, green tea, condiments and various cigarette brands. She is asking for a new loan in order to purchase a large bag of sugar, three cartons of 10 packs of cigarettes and a variety of condiments. Profits from these sales will allow her to assist her husband in taking care of the family expenses.

loans.use: purchase a large bag of sugar, three cartons of 10 packs of cigarettes and a variety of condiments

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est une femme de 32 ans fiancée mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 06 et 17 ans.tous 3 vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail de l'huile de palme dans un marché de la place depuis 03 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter le stock des bidons d'huiles de palme lui  qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Cécile is a 32 year old woman, engaged, and the mother of three children between the ages of 6 and 17, all of whom attend school. She is a storekeeper and has been selling palm oil at the market for the last three years. She knows where to stock up on supplies, and knows especially well the customers that she acquired throughout the years, thanks to her experience in this sector. She is often faced with a depleted stock, as she is often required to sell out her entire stock before being able to purchase new products given a lack of treasury. She hopes to purchase larger quantities of palm oil containers in order to better satisfy the constant customer demands and to avoid stock ruptures. She will save any profits to grow the business as well as take care of the needs of her family.

loans.use: increase her stock of palm oil containers

loans.name: Mwito Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vumilia est une commerçante depuis 10 ans et membre d’une association  d’affaires                 «  Mwito », âgée  de 40 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle a sollicité un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Elle va  acheter un ballon  de friperie pour accroitre son business. Son conjoint est  un cultivateur.  Elle avait commencé avec ses fonds propre reçu de sa famille biologique. Dans l’avenir,  elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs exclus  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Vumilia has been a storekeeper for the last 10 years and the member of a business association called Mwito. She is 40 years old and the mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She sells used clothing. She is asking for a loan from Hekima in order to purchase a large amount of used clothing in order to grow her business. Her partner is a farmer. She began this business with money received from her biological family. In the future, she hopes to educate and feed her children. She is thus thankful to Hekima for the support provided to small entrepreneurs that are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: purchase a bag of used clothing

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en: Arturo is married and lives in Tabid, Ozamiz City, Philippines with his family. Arturo is operating a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members. He has been doing this for more than 32 years to make a living. In 2007, he joined GDMPC and his previous loan that was used in his business was successfully repaid. Recently, he borrowed a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase rice and corn grits for sale in addition to his inventory working capital. He is determined and hopeful to earn more profit in this investment and save for the better future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits for sale in his general store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace of Clarin, Misamis Occidental is married with four children. To make a living, Grace operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. Aside from this, she also engages in raising pigs for sale. She joined GDMPC in 2010 and her previous loan that was used to repair her vehicle was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feeds for her livestock. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her livestock.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en: Irine is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in Batumi district. Her son works in security and this is the only source of income of their family. Other members of the family are unemployed now. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. So, she decided to start her own business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of $3000, she will purchase a stock of groceries and will open a grocery store. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. She sends her regards to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Café Des Arts Group

texts.fr: CAFÉ DES ARTS est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Ablawa Carine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 33 ans. Ablawa Carine a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Ablawa Carine est célibataire avec un enfant, scolarisé et à sa  charge. Les charges de ménage, sont supportées par Ablawa Carine. Pour faire face à ses responsabilités Ablawa Carine vend des vivres et des boissons à son domicile depuis six ans. Ablawa Carine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ablawa Carine s’associe aux autres membres du groupe CAFÉ DES ARTS pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Cafe Des Arts is a group made up of four people, who all live in the same area. The representative of the group, Ablawa Carine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 33 years old. Ablawa Carine attended school through the secondary level. She is single and has one child, who goes to school and is under her care. Ablawa Carine takes care of the household expenses.

To meet these needs, Ablawa Carine has been selling food and drinks from her home for six years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business, Ablawa Carine joined the other members in the Cafe Des Arts group to seek their first loan with Alide.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks

loans.name: Gulcan

texts.en:
Gülcan remarks that with the previous loan she received from Maya, she renewed her self-confidence by making her own money. A mother of two,  Gülcan operates a tobacco shop. With the new loan, she is going to receive, she plans to purchase new supplies and increase her sales. She had an  unfortunate family life. After he worked abroad for a long period of time, her husband was imprisoned and will now join the army. She says that she has  to work for her children, but it is more important for her to show her children that they have a well-respected, strong mother. She aims to be in a position  that will let her help needy people and provide homes for homeless people. She has goals that she is strictly determined to achieve and has a lot of  ambition for that.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:
Gülcan  Hanım  daha  önce  Maya'dan  bireysel  kredi  kullanarak  iş  yaptığını  ve  bu  sayede  para kazanarak  kendisine  olan  güvenini  tazelediğini  söyüyor.İki  cocuk  annesi  olan  Gülcan  Hanım  tütün ürünleri  satışı  yaptığı  bir  dükkan  işletiyor.Alacağı  krediyle  dükkanı  için  malzeme  almayı  ve satışlarını  arttırmayı  planlıyor.Talihsiz  bir  aile  hayatı  olan  Gülcan  Hanımın  eşi  uzun  süre yurtdışında  çalıştıktan  sonra  cezaevine  girmiş  ve  şimdi  askere  gidecek.Çocuklarının  masrafları  için çalışmak  zorunda  olduğunu   belirtiyor  ama  daha  önemlisi  cocuklarına  saygı  duyulan  güçlü  bir anneleri  olduğunu  göstermek  istiyor.İleride  muhtaçlara  yardım  edebilecek,  evsizlere  ev  sağlayabilecek  konumda  olmayı  hedefliyor.Hırslı  bir  yapısı  olan  Gülcan  Hanımın  güçlü  yapısı ve ulaşmaya  kesin  kararlı  olduğu  hedefleri var.

loans.use: to purchase new supplies for her general store.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Mrs. Bolormaa is 36-years-old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She teaches Mongolian language to students at high school and recently took her maternity leave. Her husband has a position of an operator at a mining company. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, shingles, hardwood floors and fiberglass. Using those materials, she wants to renovate her wooden house as preparation for the upcoming winter. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they won't burn much coal, thus releasing less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, shingles, and fiberglass to renovate her house.

loans.name: Henriette's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Henriette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 55 ans. Henriette n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Henriette est veuve sans enfant. Henriette a trois enfants à sa charge. Les différentes charges du ménage, sont supportées par dame Henriette. Pour ce faire, Henriette vend de la nourriture(igname frites et des beignets à base de farine de blé) à son domicile depuis trente ans. Henriette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Henriette s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un quatrième crédits auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four people who live in the same area. The representative of the group, Henriette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 55 years old. Henriette did not go school. She is a widow without children, but she takes care of three [other] children. Henriette is responsible for the various household expenses.

To meet these needs, Henriette has been selling food (yam fries and beignets [a type of donut] made of wheat flour) from her home for thirty years. She procures her goods from a market in Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business, Henriette has joined with the other members of her group to seek their fourth loan from Alide. Their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy yams and wheat flour

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a lady of forty-two years; she is married to Sospeter, and a mother of three children. She does a welding business and has been in this business for eight years now. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This will be Lucy's third loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire amount to buy grinders. In the future, she wants to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy grinders for use in her welding business.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en: Maryjane is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. She runs a general store for a living, while her husband works as a security guard in a private company. She joined GDMPC in 2009; her previous loan used in her business was successfully repaid. Recently, she asks for a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase dried fish and bagoong (salted fish) for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and bagoong for sale in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cooking oil, wheat flour, and baking powder for baking bread.

loans.name: Félicienne Akouélé's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Félicienne Akouélé (qui a la main levée sur la photo),âgée de 49 ans est mariée à un certain Mathurin. Félicienne Akouélé n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et un à leur charge. Félicienne Akouélé vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour ce faire, Félicienne Akouélé vend depuis seize ans des tissus et des assiettes par la méthode de distribution. Félicienne Akouélé s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C'est pour la première fois que Félicienne Akouélé ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de satisfaire la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people, who all live in the same area. The representative of the group, Félicienne Akouélé (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 49 years old and married to a certain Mathurin. The couple has two children, who both go to school and are under their care. Félicienne Akouélé lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various family expenses. Félicienne Akouélé did not go to school. 

To meet her needs, Félicienne Akouélé has been selling fabrics and plates through a distribution system for 16 years. She procures her goods in a market in Benin. This is the first time that Félicienne Akouélé and the other members of her group have asked for financial support from Alide in order to strengthen their businesses and to satisfy their customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric and plates

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a lady of forty-two years, and a mother of two children. She has rental houses in Kinoo in the outskirts of Kangemi; she has been in this business for four years now and gets monthly income of KES 34,000.

This will be Teresia's fifth loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to pay school fees for her child who is in university. In the future, she wants to educate her children well.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en mai 2010.Il est composé de membres issus du même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

Celle qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 28 ans,elle est mariée et mére d'une fille.

Sa principale activité est la vente de mil,d'arachide et de l'huile.

Avec l'argent du financement,elle compte acheter 02 sacs de 50 kg d'arachide à 12500f l'un soit une valeur de 25000f,66 kg de mil à 150f le kg et un bidon de 20 l à 15000f.

Son objectif est d'assurer les dépenses quotidiennes et augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2010 and its members are from the same village. They engage in small-scale commerce and farming. The one whose hand is raised on the right of the photo is the leader of the group. She is 28 years old, married, and mother to a daughter. Her main activity is selling millet, groundnuts, and oil. 

With this loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of ground nuts at 12,500 francs each, for a total of 25,000 francs, and then 66 kilograms of millet at 150 francs per kilogram and a 20-liter drum [of oil] at 15,000 francs. 

Her goal is to ensure the everyday expenses and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet, groundnuts, and oil
